venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
There are two educational events at NYSEC this month. 

1. Sustainable Living Support Circle  1:00PM   


Curt Collier, Leader Presides 

Gather to discuss the impact of lifestyle choices on our planet and ways to adapt that a make meaningful difference. We engage in serious and practical discussion about culinary choices, commuting alternatives, and how our purchases aid or hamper the natural world. Participants are asked to share openly with others in a supportive environment.

2. Readings in Deep Ecology  4:00PM    

Moderator: Leader Curt Collier 

Each month we’ll explore the writings of famous environmental authors.  Explore chapters and selections from the works of famous environmental authors—Edward Abbey, Rachel Carson, Jane Goodall, Aldo Leopold, Richard Louv, Wangari Maathai, John Muir, and Michael Pollan, among others. Read the selections together, and then discuss the important points the writers were striving to uphold. This is a great way to delve into classic environmental literature. 

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.
results.how_to_find_us: Leaders' Office
results.name: Sustainable Living Support Circle and Readings in Deep Ecology

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

Here's a video from our last performance, Funk! "Cissy Strut"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ow7JjaVa3bU

This is a Blues Rock Jam Ensemble.

We will have charts and specific guitar parts as well as lots of room to jam and develop solo technique.

We'll play Cream, Zeppelin, B.B.King, Hendrix and more classics of rock and blues.

Acoustic, electric guitars and bass welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


Vocals welcome!

This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30)

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Sunday 3-5pm starting January 10th til April 17th, a week before the performance, 15 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (15 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $365  (you save $40 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2VLVLRLATSNKU


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 3pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( 

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

Let's jam those tunes!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge
results.name: Blues Rock Jam Ensemble

results.description:
******THIS TOURNAMENT IS NOW CANCELLED*****


LOCATION: The Pitch, Brooklyn's first soccer-specific indoor facility, located in Williamsburg, adjacent to McCarren Park on N14th St.

ALL PROCEEDS FROM THE RAFFLE WILL GO TO STREET SOCCER USA & THE NY INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS LEAGUE

<a href="https://tms.ezfacility.com/OnlineRegistrations/Register.aspx?CompanyID=4838&GroupID=1493410"></a>

Following the tournament, we'll carry on with drinks and food - and a raffle - at Berry Park. The raffle will include prizes from Storelli protective gear (leg guards, slider shorts, and more), NY Cosmos and other apparel, and gift certificates to local businesses. 

In order to book your spot, there is a small charge ($10), which isn't exactly a registration fee but payment for raffle tickets. The tickets are $2 each so you get five tickets for registering. (You can purchase more tickets when you're at The Pitch)

There is also an after-party which starts at 8:00pm, at Berry Park (our partner bar, right next door). ALL PROCEEDS GOES TO CHARITY.

Tournament Details: 

3+1 (teams must have a keeper). 
Co-ed (each team must have at least one female player and one male player on the roster - no 'on-field' gender requirements). 
Each team plays a minimum of 5 matches. 
Top four teams progress to playoffs. 
Please note: the games are short, fast and furious. No team breaks for more than about 20 minutes between games. 
Recommended roster size: 5. 
Bring your own shirts (if you don't have them, bibs/pinnies provided).

**RSVPing only on this page will not guarantee you a place in the tournament

results.description:
Due to the weather, this class is being postponed.  Please keep an eye out for the new date to be announced on Monday or early during the week.


January 24, 2016  

Practicing Ethical WitchCraft

o  The Wiccan Rede 

o  The Witch's Creed 

o  The Thirteen Goals of a Witch 

o  The Law of Return ("Threefold Law") 

o  Working With Permission 

o  The Witches Pyramid 

o  What do we believe? 

o  The Principles of Belief 

o  Practical Laws of the Craft 

o  Pentagram / Pentacle – What is its’ meaning? 

o  Magickal Jargon and their meanings in the handout

Imbolc/Imbolg briefing handout

$30 in person/$33 via paypal- PLEASE bring your receipt to class.


WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training.  We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Astrology Series, Organic Herbal Soap Making, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more. 

What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.

Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, and now our newly formed private FB group just for our students to converse, further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment.

The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!

We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy*. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.

We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished so far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Circle and do hope that after reading you will decide to join us as a Academy Student and member of The NYC Wiccan Family Temple.

We strive to provide a comprehensive selection of training programs and as such offers many other Elective Craft courses and training opportunities for seekers of knowledge and magickal expertise. We encourage you to visit our CURRICULUM PAGE & CRAFT CLASSES PAGE for a complete list of current and future programs.

We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

WE ARE THE MOST COMPREHENSIVELY TAUGHT WITCHCRAFT ACADEMY WITHIN THE NEW YORK CITY AREA.

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO FIND OUT FURTHER INFORMATION REGARDING THESE CLASSES, PLEASE GO TO www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org YOU WILL FIND REGISTRATION INFORMATION, PRICES AND OUR FULL CURRICULLUM. YOU CAN JOIN IN THESE CLASSES AT ANY TIME, AND CATCH UP WITH THE CLASSES YOU MISSED NEXT TIME IT COMES AROUND.

IF YOU HAVE NOT DONE SO, PLEASE DO BRING YOUR APPLICATION FILLED OUT WITH YOU WHEN YOU COME TO CLASS. ALSO, BRING A NOTE BOOK AND PEN OR PENCIL.

There is a one time fee per year of $25.00 registration fee.

If you pay online please bring a receipt of payment as we do not always have time to check paypal the day of the class, or we will expect you pay at the class or gathering.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT: 
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org 
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com 
www.romantichandfastings.webs.com 
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
Lee Reiser and some friends will be taking small rec./white water boats to  Dunwoodie G.C. in Yonkers, NY. Our plan is to Toboggan down the slope in our kayaks! We also have a long rope to help pull the kayaks back up the hill.

We will have old paddles to steer with and we plan to bring some helmets, old pfds for padding, thick leather gloves and balaclavas (face masks).  If you plan on attending, wear multi layers of wicking clothing topped by a shell to break the cold wind. Don't forget hats, gloves, cameras, sunglasses, snacks and a thermos of hot non-alcoholic whatever. If you don't have a small playboat, that's OK as we can take turns. Feel free to bring any small boats and "snow toys". 

We will also demonstrate the safe way to exit the kayak while underway.

Also attend if you just need to laugh!

As always, you partake at your own risk.


Follow directions below not the address above:

Directions from NYC:
H.H Pkwy north to Saw Mill Pkwy north.
Exit (5) for Yonkers Ave. - Left onto Yonkers Ave east.
Quick Left onto Grace Ave.
Park in lot on left - hill on the right.

North of Yonkers:
Saw Mill south.
Exit for Rumsey Rd. 
Make U turn for Saw Mill north.
then as above.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for people with white water boats!
results.name: Toboggan down the slope in our kayaks!

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.name: Sunday Pick-up Parade Grounds 2:00 PM

results.description:
Brooklynites and other New Yorkers! Come out to Ange Noir Cafe and play some Magic the Gathering, whether you are new to the game or an experienced player. I bring a bunch of cards and some pre-made decks, so we always have enough stuff for all. Feel free to bring your own decks (Commander aka EDH, Modern, Standard, etc.) along if you want. And invite friends ... the more the merrier.

***The given time-slot can be shifted or extended to fit schedules or we want to play longer but please let me know a little in advance so we can schedule properly.*** 

If you can pitch in a couple quarters or a buck to help cover the Meetup group cost (bi-annual of $72), it would be greatly appreciated. Donations only; NOT REQUIRED. Again, this group is here to provide a non-financially demanding option for learning and playing/practicing the game.

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3:30-5:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

Parents, grandparents, and congregants and visitors are invited to consider some deeper questions, and share wisdoms together.

Parents of teens: How, during an election cycle, do we encourage children to be free thinkers?

Parents of school-age children: How do we discuss the violence and atrocities around the world and in our own country, in order not to frighten children, but make it meaningful?

Parents of young children: In this ever advancing age of technology, how do we balance our family’s screen time with human connection?

Bring your issues and questions with you or email them to Jen Klein. 

City Congregation member and parent of two children, Jennifer Naparstek Klein, Psy.D, a licensed psychologist who specializes in child and family psychology, will lead this interactive session.

results.description:
This is a fun & unique event where you can go back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster. At the same time, make some new friends, meet some singles...and maybe more!

We will meet for a pre-mingle at 4pm at a local bar/pub near the museum, where we will hand out the tickets and head over to the museum at 5pm for our 5:30pm private tour.

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to buy ticket, closer to event date. Food/drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $29.75 to $39.75 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket). Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. 

Get your tickets ASAP at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/dates/Jan-24-2016_at_0400PM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FiRbqNyVskg

About the Museum:


Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. 

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills.


GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/dates/Jan-24-2016_at_0400PM

Why my RSVP says +30? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have 30+ members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.

About the Museum:

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. results.description:
Neolyth welcomes back Cheryl Anne Morse providing guidance through your own life's true 'memory lane'. Have you ever wondered about your life before this birth? Whether your beliefs embrace the reality of past lives or not - you can bring your open mind and curiosity for exploring life's secrets. Keep it simple and enjoy the discussion with like minded people. Cheryl has been doing past life regression in the form of guided imagery for over ten years now. She's been researching the topic for her own healing for 30 years now. Her approach is simple and effective.  There will be time afterwards for a cup of tea and some Q & A.

In Cheryl's words: "Past Life Regression is a Shamanic deep trance state of consciousness in which you receive images and/or sensory input, which give information about your past lives. This information can enter the mind stream in small bits or in a straightforward stream of consciousness storyline. Past Life Regression is a way of obtaining insights from such sources as your higher self, inner wisdom and the wisdom of the universe. Often, such insights are extremely valuable and healing in regard to your present life situation, providing highly relevant background information to help you move forward on your current life's journey"
results.name: Uncovering Wisdom from Your Past Lives!

results.description:
TICKETS: $20 

Online: 

http://www.aquariuscomposers.eventbrite.com

or at the door. Likely to sell out, we're encouraging buying tix online.

PROGRAM ; CONCERT & CHAT

Wolfgang Amadeus MOZART [masked])

KV 457 – Piano Sonata in C Minor - What is a Sonata and what are the Aquarian influences in Mozart's character?

KV 331 – Piano Sonata in A Major, “Alla Turca” - How was Mozart inspired by the Turkish culture? Hear it from a Turkish pianist!

Franz Peter SCHUBERT [masked])

D.780 – Russian Air – No.3 from 6 Moments Musicaux - Schubert's life & legacy

D.899 – Impromptu No.2 in E Flat Major - Aquarian inventiveness & humanitarianism in Schubert

D.935 – Impromptu No.3 in B Flat Major – Theme & 5 Variations - Become a "wanderer" in Paris in romantic style thorough a visual collage

Felix MENDELSSOHN [masked])

Gondola Songs from Songs without Words - Join us for a gondola ride in Venice!

Op.19, No.6 in G MinorOp.30, No.6 in F# Minor

Op.102, No.3 in A Minor, “Tarantelle” - Italian influence in Mendelssohn's music

Op.14 – Rondo Cappriccioso - The role of his lovers and his family in Mendelssohn's music and his legacy as a "multitasker"

Chatty Pianist EMIR GAMSIZOGLU celebrates the music of the three major aquarians of classical music; W.A. Mozart, F. Schubert and F. Mendelssohn. His “chat” will focus on these composers lives and musical legacy as well as the relationship between astrological signs and composers’ characters. 

“Emir is a musician of sensitivity” – David Dubal

----
results.name: AQUARIUS COMPOSERS with CHATTY PIANIST by the fireplace at Caffe Vivaldi!

results.description:
Looking for something fun and crazy to do today? Look no further!

Join us for a game of bubble ball soccer in park slope brooklyn from 4 - 6pm. In case you don't know what bubble ball soccer is, it's where soccer meets sumo wrestling.

Your goal is to bounce, roll, bump and torpedo into your opponent to prevent them from scoring. Also, there are no fouls ... and your huge plastic bubble ball will mean you won't have to worry about bumps and bruises at the end of the day.

Tickets are $45  with promo code '20dollarcode'
The game will be indoors so play rain or shine.

Hurry before the chance of 30 degree weather sneaking up on us returns (fingers crossed mother nature will turn up fashionably late this year)There is a 10 person minimum for this game to be on and a maximum of 20 people. 10 players will be on the field at a time.

Once you RSVP, you must make your payment at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/bubble-ball-soccer-nyc-open-pickup-game-tickets-18879277427 to be confirmed.

If you are bringing a friend(s) you must pre pay for their spot as well.

xxx

If you would like to book a private game for you and your friends (birthday party / bachelorette or bachelorette party), or would just like more information and answers to FAQ visit http://www.bubbleballsoccernyc.com
results.name: bubble ball soccer pick up game

results.description:
This is a fun & unique event where you can go back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster. At the same time, make some new friends, meet some singles...and maybe more!

We will meet for a pre-mingle at 4pm at a local bar/pub near the museum, where we will hand out the tickets and head over to the museum at 5pm for our 5:30pm private tour.

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to buy ticket, closer to event date. Food/drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $29.75 to $39.75 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket). Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. 

Get your tickets ASAP at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/dates/Jan-24-2016_at_0400PM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FiRbqNyVskg

About the Museum: 

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. 

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/dates/Jan-24-2016_at_0400PM

Why my RSVP says +30? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have 30+ members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.

results.description:
MEETUP MEMBERS USE CODE: imonthelist FOR 10% OFF 


JUSTFCKINGOWNIT.EVENTBRITE.COM


We're taking our 3,000 sq. ft. **secret location** and making it THE space for you to OWN IT. 


Consider House of MissChief your accountability partners. Bring all your procrastinatin' ass girl friends and let's make it real!

Whatever IT is- You can do it, have it, achieve it, all you have to do is decide on it.

Hosted by our resident Queen of Cray, @hayleyjmckenzie of BBeaute Nation, DJ Taela Naomi, and featuring a tantatilizing, tidday-sssshakin' performance from Brooklyn's own Chicava Honeychild of Brown Girls Burlesque. 

Imagine a huge slumber party, but with goals. And nobody's crying about their ex. We're transporting all our precious darlings to a vibrant & funky Moroccan-themed oasis, complete with ambiance for stimulating the heart & mind's every desire & all the girl power anthems you can stomach.

All crafting materials will be provided so you can create a gorgeous vision board (don't worry we're going to lead you through it), as well as bottomless cocktails (Thank Mama Smirnoff!) and delicious food samplings. (Suede Modern Caribbean Cuisine is feeding all the chi'ren of House of MissChief.)  

Massage & hookah are optional and will be available for purchase. Oh and let's not even talk about the party bags at the end...


Crazy right?

We wouldn't have it any other way.

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. 

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/dates/Jan-24-2016_at_0400PM

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/dates/Jan-24-2016_at_0400PM

Why my RSVP says +30? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have 30+ members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.

results.description:
The January Meetup for the the North Jersey Poly Potluck is cancelled. I apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused anyone.  Read on to learn more about what is is coming up in the future for this group...

In a continued desire to support and meet  the needs of the community the North Jersey Poly Potluck is in the process of an evolution. 

A larger group needs a larger leadership team and that team is working on looking for a larger space and exploring a name change to better represent the expanded mission of the group. 

The current plan is to unveil the next iteration of the group on February 28th - so Save the Date and head on over  the Meetup calendar to RSVP. 


Warmly,
Lisa Myla

ps- feel free to post your suggestions and wish list of topics and what you would like to see in this group evolution.

results.description:
Come and join us January 24, 2016 for an evening of detoxification, improvement in our breathing, and a more focused mind with power vinyasa.


This 60 minute class is done in a room heated to about 100 degrees. Be sure you are well hydrated before taking the class and not to eat too much. Bring your own mat, towel, and water. If you do not have these items, the studio will provide these items for a small fee. 


The studio has changing rooms and bathrooms, as well as a place for your personal belongings but there is no shower in the studio.

Please turn off or silence your phone when you arrive. All cell phone use is to be done outside of the studio and reception area.

Pricing - Cash only 

Classes …………………………………………….. $5 


Mat Rental ………………………………………… $2
Towel Rental …………………………………….. $2
Water ………………………………………………. $1

No registration necessary! 

Although there is No registration necessary, we'd like to to RSVP so that we can know who will be joining us.


Please arrive at least 15 minutes early for class.The class begin promptly on time. No late arrivals: buzzers are turned off and doors are locked when class begins.
results.how_to_find_us: The studio is located at the SW corner of 38th Street and 6th Ave. The entrance is ON 38th Street at the nail salon sign.
results.name: Hot Yoga

results.description:
A special discount offer from CMS!

Four exceptional CMS pianists share the stage (and sometimes, piano!), performing works that range from playful to fiery. Symphonic sonorities and astounding technical skill are sure to guarantee a mesmerizing evening.

Arensky Silhouettes, Suite No. 2 for Two Pianos, Op. 23 (1892)
Bartók The Miraculous Mandarin for Piano, Four Hands, Op. 19 [masked])
Lutoslawski Variations on a Theme by Paganini for Two Pianos (1941)
Rachmaninov Symphonic Dances for Two Pianos, Op. 45 (1940)

Alessio Bax, Juho Pohjonen, Orion Weiss, Wu Qian, piano

50% off tickets for New York Chamber Music Meetup members with the code PP50. Click here to visit the CMS website and use the code when selecting tickets. <a href="http://www.chambermusicsociety.org/seasontickets/event/1930"></a>
results.name: Pianos/Pianists - The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .
results.name: Astoria Writers Write(!)

results.description:
Basses, Altos, Vocal Percussionists, Arrangers, and Rehearsal Leaders needed for Vocal Soulstice A Cappella Group


Seeking new talent! New York City based a cappella group Vocal Soulstice is looking for singers to join our musical family. Auditions will be held on Sunday, January 24th from 5-8pm (our normal rehearsal time) in room 710 of the National Opera Center, 330 7th Avenue (btw 28th & 29th Streets), New York, NY.

If you are looking to sing with a bunch of awesome people and can commit to weekly rehearsals, we would love to hear you sing for us!  We are particularly interested in basses, altos, vocal percussionists, arrangers, and people with experience teaching music and/or leading a rehearsal, but we will welcome people of any voice part to audition!  Please prepare a solo (a verse and a chorus) of a song of your choosing. Auditions will last approximately 15 minutes. You may fill out the following form to sign up:

http://goo.gl/forms/4ayyf8mqef
results.how_to_find_us: Studio 710
results.name: Auditions for Soul A Cappella group VOCAL SOULSTICE!!!

results.description:
Due to the weather, this class is being postponed.  Please keep an eye out for the new date to be announced on Monday or early during the week.


Crafting the Witch:  Enchanted Oils, Incense & Baths

Have you ever browsed through a magickal shop and wondered how all those lovely Incenses, Oils and Bath Salts were made? Perhaps you’ve already tried your hand at making them and wish to refine your technique? Then this workshop is for you! 

Get ready for some creative fun with experienced instructors and hands-on learning.  You will walk away with your own… Incense, Oil and Bath salts that you made from scratch.  

Learn how to create your own recipes and how to make the finished product look, smell and work just like the ones in the shops.

$40.00 for the class plus $10 supplies (booklet included) $54 online

PLEASE ENTER BUILDING WITH CODE #1357, TAKE ELEVATOR TO 4TH FLOOR AND KNOCK TO ENTER...

results.description:
******THIS TOURNAMENT IS NOW CANCELLED*****

LOCATION: The Pitch, Brooklyn's first soccer-specific indoor facility, located in Williamsburg, adjacent to McCarren Park on N14th St.

ALL PROCEEDS FROM THE RAFFLE WILL GO TO STREET SOCCER USA & THE NY INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS LEAGUE

<a href="https://tms.ezfacility.com/OnlineRegistrations/Register.aspx?CompanyID=4838&GroupID=1493410"></a>

Following the tournament, we'll carry on with drinks and food - and a raffle - at Berry Park. The raffle will include prizes from Storelli protective gear (leg guards, slider shorts, and more), NY Cosmos and other apparel, and gift certificates to local businesses. 

In order to book your spot, there is a small charge ($10), which isn't exactly a registration fee but payment for raffle tickets. The tickets are $2 each so you get five tickets for registering. (You can purchase more tickets when you're at The Pitch)

There is also an after-party which starts at 8:00pm, at Berry Park (our partner bar, right next door). ALL PROCEEDS GOES TO CHARITY.

Tournament Details: 


3+1 (teams must have a keeper).
Co-ed (each team must have at least one female player and one male player on the roster - no 'on-field' gender requirements).
Each team plays a minimum of 5 matches.
Top four teams progress to playoffs.
Please note: the games are short, fast and furious. No team breaks for more than about 20 minutes between games.
Recommended roster size: 5.
Bring your own shirts (if you don't have them, bibs/pinnies provided).

**RSVPing only on this page will not guarantee you a place in the tournament
results.name: Open House Soccer Tournament @ The Pitch, Williamsburg 5:00PM KO ($10 Donation)

results.description:
Chez Josephine
414 West 42nd St (Btw 9th and 10th Ave)
Sunday, Jan 24th (limited to 30 members)
5:30 optional drinks, 6:15pm dinner
$78 3- course, glass wine, coffee, tax and tip

Note: You must prepay online at www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/chez-josephine/ to be on the list. ALL of our events are prepaid in advance as I expect 30 people to be at this dinner I will not take payment at the door and I have to prepay before each dinner and guarantee headcount, seating and staffing.

Zagat rated saying, “they hit the high notes at this old-style Parisian boite featuring French Bistro fare, colorful boudoir decor and a pianist tinkling the ivories.” If you have never been to Chez Josephine’s, you have missed out on trip right into Paris. 4.5 stars on Opentable they write, “The last of its kind near 42nd Street, Chez Josephine is a neighborhood gem founded in 1986 by Jean-Claude Baker as a tribute to legendary Josephine Baker. This Parisian bistro offers live piano music and a tantalizing menu in an intimate setting of red velvet walls, a cavalcade of chandeliers and a blue-tin ceiling. Chez Josephine draws a crowd unlike any other in New York as food critic Bryan Miller noted when he wrote: “The dining room is a confluence of the famous and the fashionable, the infamous and unsung, and indeed you feel the magic of Chez Josephine.” A TripAdvisor “Certificate of Excellence,” winner and ranked by them in the top 2% of all NYC restaurants. Our menu is French inspired with escargot, French onion soup and Belgium endive salad to start, trout amandine, steak frites and coq a vin as entrees finished off with delicious French desserts
results.name: Chez Jospehine

group.name: Travel and Dinner Group for Mature Adults

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Happy New Year Everyone!

I'm Robbie and I picked this group up after the ownership lapsed. I saw there hadn't been any meetups in a little while so I'd like to restore some consistency to that. Most of you are probably already familiar with my meetups from the WWE Fans Meetup Group, but for those of you who are not I'll look forward to hopefully seeing you at our meetups moving forward. So with that said, let's move on to our 2016 meetups!

As always we'll kick off the new year with one of our favorite PPV's of the year .... the Royal Rumble. Not much has been announced for this one yet, but we know we'll have rumble itself to look forward to and that's plenty enough to ensure a fun night!

We'll be meeting at McHale's for this one with no cover, $4 drinks specials and a special menu specifically for the WWE fans. McHale's is located on 51st St and 8th Ave in NYC, with 2 floors, plenty of screens (including a 100 inch projector) and very friendly staff!

Arrive early for this one as we'll be expecting a packed house. Any questions please feel free to let me know!

Hope to see you all on January 24th. Spread the word!

Cheers,
Robbie

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Jan 24, 2016 - March 6th
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:  Feb 7th No class!
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452342

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135393">

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408"></a>

results.description:
Fun time last night, what a meetup im glad everyone had a great time and best of all meet new people and laugh with, were going to continue these meetups as long as the club keeps giving us free tickets.

I want to restate that the show starts typically at 8:15, most meetup members show up at 7 - 7:30, we all sit together and have our own meetup tables, so its good to come early so you can meet everyone, if you show up at 8:30 we can do is seat you cause the show already started. So please come early this is a big meetup and the goal of it is not just to laugh but to laugh with new friends.

For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Tracy Morgan, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

This weeks Host: Akaash Singh (MTVs Wild n out brings you , Cyrus Mcqueen, Mike Cannon (MTVs Guy Code), Dante Nero, and of course Esther Ku. and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander. Last few meetups Jay Pharaoh From SNL dropped by

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members.

This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup is back at Stand Up NY Free Admission With Esther Ku

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

*** If you haven't joined our Facebook group yet, make sure you do! That's where a lot of the action happens: links to our photo albums, extra workouts, happy hours, random funny meme postings, you name it!

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Shades of Grey.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - Shades of Grey

results.description:
Open Flow

All Levels. Modifications taught and encouraged. Pleasure and fun, breathing, moving, smiling. This class is designed to start with vinyasa flow to warm up, and include standing poses and core work. For students who feel the urge to move seamlessly from one posture to the next with the grace of a dancer and the mindfulness of a yogi. Poses are held for a moderate length of time to create awareness in the mind and body. Pranayama (breathing techniques) and meditation are introduced.

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.
results.name: New moms' discussion group

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.description:
Come start the week off warming up  with an easy walk at one of Bergen Countys' best parks for walks and biking.  Lets enjoy the calm after the storm and the winter wonderland left in its wake! WE will be starting PROMPTLY AT 2:05 so don;t be late!

This will be about a 2 hour walk, covering approx. 5 1/2 miles  at a moderate pace on a paved, level path, that follows along the Saddle River where we were once lucky enough, to spot a red fox!  There is plenty of wildlife around if you take the time to look.  We will first pass by the dog runs to enjoy our furry 4 legged friends  and then pick up the trail nearer the exit to the park,   cross over a  bridge and  turn left at the "T"  to see the waterfall in the bend, then head to the pond at the Glenrock section of the park and then retrace our steps back to the parking lot.

ALWAYS KEEP TO THE RIGHT ON THESE SHARED PATHS TO ALLOW BICYCLISTS, SKATERS, ETC TO PASS SAFELY!

MEET AT THE BENCH BY THE FLAG POLE, IN FRONT OF THE CAMP SUNSHINE SNOWFLAKE BLDG. All you need are  good weather resistant walking/hiking shoes or boots, depending upon the weather and trail conditions(which are generally cleared after snowstorms) and don't forget your water.  Dress in layers for the changing weather and don't forget those cameras and binoculars! Not for singles only.

Optional dinner at Charlie Browns located at 95 Linwood Ave., Township of Washington, NJ  just a short drive from the park. (left out of park onto Ridgewood Ave., left on Paramus rd., right onto Linwood ave. (stay left at fork) to stay on Linwood ave.  Charlie Browns will be on you left.

DIRECTIONS: FROM ROCKLAND TAKE 17 SOUTH AND  TAKE THE PARAMUS RD EXIT AND HEAD TOWARD RIDGEWOOD.  TURN RT ON E. RIDGEWOOD AVE AND THE PARK ENTRANCE WILL BE ON YOUR RIGHT IN A SHORT DISTANCE.

Inclement weather cancels, always check the day of an event for possible changes.
results.how_to_find_us: By the bench, by the flag pole, in front of the Camp Snowflake Sunshine bldg./ LEAVING PROMPTLY AT 2:05!
results.name: Monday Winter Wonderland Walk at the Saddle River Cnty. Park Wild Duck Pond

results.description:
Route to be determined that day.  This is a fast paced workout, less of a social event due to the cooler temps and darkness, therefore will be limited in size. Everyone goes on the waitlist. Please read the event in it's entirety and respond to the questions asked when you rsvp.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp,  minimum 1 liter of water and appropriate weather related gear. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due to the nature of this event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. We will hike a minimum of 4 miles and 1200 EG. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any question.


Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.
results.name: ADULT BALLET CLASS Level: Elementary

results.description:
Join Foodstand and Slow Money NYC, for an evening of drinks and collaborative thinking. Good Food Spotlight is a monthly event series designed to provide entrepreneurs in the food space with a unique opportunity to showcase their product or business and receive instant feedback from a diverse panel of experts and audience collaborators.

Good Food Spotlight empowers consumers to re-shape the food economy, fulfilling our mission: To help good food ventures be the best they can be.

Please order ticket through EventBrite

6:00PM: Coaching Office Hours + Doors Open 

7:00PM: Community Announcements + Alumni Keynote + Introductions

7:10PM: Spotlight Presentations by 4-5 Entrepreneurs in which:

• Entrepreneur presents an idea, product, challenge or service for  4 minutes. 

• 3+ Experts give feedback & ask questions in the next 4 minutes. 

• Audience votes on live-text questions submitted by the Entrepreneur.

8:15PM: Drinks and Networking for All with Entrepreneurs, Creators, Innovators

Have a food or drink business that you're working on? 

Inspired by Slow Money Principles? 

Have an existing local shop or online food venture that you want feedback on? 

Have some questions you want audience of food-lovers and experts to weigh in on? 

Get involved: http://www.thefoodstand.com/spotlight
results.how_to_find_us: Tell Security you are going to Purpose on 6th Floor.  Buzz in!
results.name: Good Food Spotlight by Slow Money NYC + Foodstand

results.description:
PUNTO is kicking off 2016 with a new round of MeetUp labs geared towards performers, artists, event professionals and just about anyone who loves PUNTO!


For our next MeetUp, join us for an actors lab on how to avoid the pitfalls of the resentertainment industry and anxiety induced audition blues presented by Kissing Lions Public Relations.  Don't hate the player or the game!

At PUNTO Space, we know how essential it is to stay in an authentic place as an artist while you share your story in your own unique way on media platforms you understand.  It's not always easy for performers to navigate, but that is why it's especially important to have creative resources, camaraderie within your creative community and the ability to collaborate in a space that embraces who you are!

Anyone who knows PUNTO Space, knows we love the arts! All performing arts professionals welcome!   


*To attend this FREE MeetUp, you must RSVP and join the PUNTO Events & Performance MeetUp group.  Please note attendees may be photographed.

Been here before and need rehearsal space?  Here's the link!   


New to PUNTO?  We'd love to show off our space!  Take a look at Studio A, B, C, and D while you're here!  Venue ratings welcome HERE!


#PUNTOMeetUpLabs
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the Meetup when you arrive and we'll show you the way!

results.description:
After many requests, I am thrilled to finally announce a weekly study group of A Course in Miracles in Westchester!

A Course in Miracles is a guide to personal and spiritual transformation. It is based on the belief that we have two thoughts systems, one based on fear and separation from the Divine and another one based on love and oneness with the Divine. The Course is designed to help us become increasingly aware of the LOVE that is already present within us to let go all of the fearful thoughts and beliefs that we hold. Students of all levels are welcome. We will start with chapter I and we will study a few of the early lessons in the Workbook. Class is free, but suggested donation is $10 since both Lyna and Café 72 are lovingly donating the time and space. ABSOLUTELY no outside food or drink are allowed. We hope to see you on Monday to experience miraculous shifts from fear to love!
results.name: A Course in Miracles Weekly Study Group

results.description:
Please note that our group and our happy hours are not for non-Asians.  

Icebreaker Game: "Find Your Partner"

We are continuing the sixth round of our icebreaker game. The beginning of the year is a great time to think about your professional and personal goals. We have had many requests for more organized introductions; as we only have two organizers, we are going to structure our game this month to help you find your future career or relationship partners!

As before, the game will start at 6:30 pm and will run until 7:30 pm. The first 25 matches will get a free drink ticket each! Here are the rules:

1. You must write your first and last name on the name tags. If you are looking for a career match, you must also write the company or industry for which you work.

2. You must find your match in one of the following ways:

a. CAREER: Find someone in your industry or in an industry to which you would want to transition. Tell that person why you want to work with them. If that person wants to work with you too, make arrangements to have coffee or meet together between this NYAPM happy hour and the next one. Once you have made plans with a date, time, and place, find the organizers for your free drink.

OR

b. RELATIONSHIP: Find someone you would like to go on a first date with. Tell that person why you would like to date them. If that person wants to go on a first date with you too, make arrangements for your first date between this NYAPM Happy Hour and the next one. Once you have made plans with a date, time, and place, find the organizers for your free drink.

Once you have completed 1 and 2(a) or 2(b) above, find one of the organizers (Richard Young or Tiffany Ma) to get your free drinks (available only for the first 25 matches – so come on time!).

--

Our monthly happy hour is our flagship event that started it all years ago in 2005. Experience what it's all about -- come and meet fellow Asian professionals in a friendly, casual atmosphere. Relax after work and meet some new people.

Because this is a free event where you are not paying a cover or door fee, we humbly request that you please buy one drink or more to support our venue since they are turning away other business to allow us to host our event (buying alcoholic drinks/soft drinks/bottled water helps support the venue -- getting free tap/iced water does not).

First time to one of our events?  See photos from previous happy hours on Meetup or Facebook.

Hope to see you there!

Also find us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/events/529608173862885/
results.name: January 2016 NYAPM Happy Hour

group.name: New York Asian Professionals Meetup- 6933 Members & growing!

We have all read about spreadsheet errors that have cost companies billions in lost capital. Even well known, world-wide companies have incurred loss and embarrassment due to omissions, mis-calculations, and inaccurate data. 

I'll share my experiences on mitigating model risk utilizing excel's security features, add-Ins, color coding, and other methods to minimize model risk within formulas and VBA.

Also, let's discuss what topics members would like to know more about.

Light refreshments will be served. See you there!

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

Sold out! Our next series of workshops will run in March.

Sign up on Meetup or visit my website:

http://www.backporchsoap.com/index.php?main_page=product_info&cPath=48_29&products_id=699

Join industry expert Marla Bosworth and learn how to make skin-nourishing and healing products with infused herbs. We will make body and lip balms as well as and body butters from scratch. This is a great class for massage therapists, spa owners, bath and body company owners, and anyone who wants to make incredibly good-for-your-body products.

As a class we'll make a batch of luscious body butters. Body butters are wonderful for massages and for dry skin. They are made differently than typical creams and lotions (they do not contain water). You'll love the price markup on these products if you make natural skincare to sell. If you don't have a business, you'll love the money saving benefit of making your own bodycare products.

Next, we'll formulate a batch of balms as we work with healing, infused herbs. We'll also create a versatile balm recipe for body and lips. We will cover the essentials of formulating, healing properties of plant oils, herbs and botanicals.

Students will take home the following:

1 - 4 oz. Organic Herbal-Infused Whipped Body Butter

1 - Organic Herbal-infused Lip Balm

1 - 4 oz. Organic Herbal-infused Body Balm

This class is open to beginner through advanced. Students will receive a class handout that includes instructions, recipes and a valuable list of my favorite places to buy supplies and equipment.

Date: Monday, Jan. 25, 2016

Time: 6 p.m.- 9:30 p.m.

Course: $135 early bird pricing until Dec. 21. Then regular price of $155. This includes workshop, ingredients, supplies and materials as well as a detailed handout.

Class Location:
Little Shop of Crafts
711 Amsterdam Ave. at 94th Street, New York City


Call Marla Bosworth of Back Porch Soap for directions/questions:[masked] (cell phone)
