results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki & Chris Pelham

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!
results.why: It's a concrete and energizing way to develop the ability to meditate and to come to know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation more clearly. You can also learn to communicate with your Inner Teacher and find peace!
results.how_to_find_us: It's located one block east of Broadway, one and half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.
results.name: A Course in Miracles ongoing classes

group.name: A Course in Miracles ongoing class

results.description:
How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? Our TurnON events offer an opportunity to connect with people in a whole new way. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you) where you get the opportunity to examine yourself through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City. This event is hosted by OneTaste NYC, an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: Intimacy & Communication Games @TurnON NYC

results.description:
Basic class. Good for beginners.

 Postures are modified to the individual. Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power yoga builds core strength, builds muscle, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and meditation after class.
results.name: Yoga - Basic Class

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. Cost to attend is $10

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON Games!

group.name: Free NYC! Free Things To Do In NYC + beyond! (or very cheap)

results.description:
Welcome to our very FIRST event in Bushwick!!!  Come see what all the HYPE is about!  

What if accessing your desire is the thing that can truly give you fulfillment? What if real health and deep intimate relationships only comes from a life lived in accordance with what your body wants? Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created. 

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: Intimacy and Communication Games in Bushwick!

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. PS: the small gym is located on the 5th floor, go through the big gym to the back. 

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $10 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.

http://www.nyurban.com/basketball/open_play_bb.html

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.description:
Hi Guys!

On Monday (1/25) we're taking over Chomp Chomp, the new West Village Singaporean hot spot that's been getting a ton of praise from the critics - NY Times Critics' Pick and selection among Pete Wells' list of the Top 10 Restaurant Dishes of 2015! Chomp Chomp is the brainchild of acclaimed Chef Simpson Wong,  and it's all about authentic Singaporean Hawker Food. Chef Wong will be serving 8 of his favorite dishes for us including Cereal Prawns, Shrimp Paste Chicken Wings, Asam Fish, and a whole lot more (full menu below).

As is the case at all of our feasts, the chefs will be coming out to introduce the dishes and share the stories behind the food.

Please note, you MUST buy tickets via the link below to grab seats. We will not be able to accommodate RSVPs on meetup.com who haven't purchased tickets via the link below.

RSVP at: https://tastingcollective.com/events/14

The price is $50 plus tax and tip, which covers the full lineup of 8 dishes.

Hope to see you guys there for what will undoubtedly be an incredible Singaporean feast!

-Nat

THE FEAST LINEUP

(all dishes are served family-style)

1. Cereal Prawns

head on prawns with crispy cereal and curry leaves

2. Hah Zheung Gai

shrimp paste chicken wings with Chinese celery, crispy garlic, and chilies

3. Pasembur

salad of cucumber, mango, shrimp fritters, tofu, egg, and cuttlefish sambal

4. Char Kway Teow

wok fried rice noodles with clams and shrimp

5. Asam Fish

Hake, okra, and tomatoes cooked in tamarind coconut sauce

6. Hainanese Chicken Rice

chicken flavor rice, cucumber, soy, chili

7. Bo Bo Cha Cha

sweet potatoes, taro root, and tapioca pearls cooked in coconut milk

8. Goreng Pisang

banana fritters, vanilla ice cream, chili flakes and sea salt
results.how_to_find_us: We're taking over the entire restaurant for this feast!
results.name: 8-Dish Chef's Choice Singaporean Feast!

group.name: Communal Feasts at Top NYC Restaurants!

results.description: You are a busy professional with unfulfilled writing goals. Even if you have the time, you can’t seem to figure out how to get your ideas out and what to do with them. You’re not sure anyone would be interested anyway. Here is a chance for you to develop the skills, build the confidence and get those ideas out of your head by eliminating the blocks that leave you feeling frustrated and unsuccessful. This 12-week writing program featuring weekly live sessions will get you writing, and writing well! Using a process that has worked for millions just like you, you will develop skills, get new resources and support that will allow you to create your own path to achieving your writing goals sooner than you think. Register before January 15, 2016 to secure 1 of 12 spots in this exclusive program. Cost for the entire program is only $299, including course manual. In 90 days, you will create habits to support your writing goals, mark your accomplishments, get accountability and develop you own plan for goal-setting and achievement that will be integrated into your daily life. Weekly 75-minute sessions are Mondays at 9PM Eastern beginning January 25.  Register here.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 6:15AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 35 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and aim to be 80 members by August 1st!


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45+ people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Sinigual Restaurant
41st and 3rd Ave
(640 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)
results.how_to_find_us: business-networking lead-generation tech-startups women-in-networking entrepreneurs
results.name: New Frontier-26 (NYC Business Networking - BNI)

results.description:
Are referrals an important part of your business? 

Then come visit our weekly BNI meeting!

BNI (Business Networking International) is an international networking and referral organization with a proven track record of generating business for its members.  

We run a weekly structured networking meeting that is open to guests in all industries. Structured networking allows everyone in attendance the opportunity to highlight themselves and what they do. If you find yourself overwhelmed or lost at typical networking events, BNI is a great option for you!

FAQs:

How does the meeting work?: When you arrive, there will be an opportunity to get catered breakfast while enjoying 15-30 minutes of open networking. After that our formal meeting begins. Each meeting includes a round of "commercials" from each member and visitor, business coaching, and a special presentation from a chapter member. We have a great leadership team that will guide all first-time guests through the process. 

How many people attend each week?: We have 15 permanent members and 5-10 additional guests per week

Can I become a member of the chapter?:  Sure! Each chapter only has 1 member per profession. If no one in our chapter does the same thing as you we welcome you to apply to join. You can learn all about the application process when you visit

What do I need bring?: We ask guests to bring enough business cards to hand out to the group (20-25)


Is there a fee to attend?: There is a $25 visitor fee, which includes numerous professionals to meet and network with as well as a hot breakfast.

HOW DO I RSVP?: You may RSVP through Meetup. In order to confirm your attendance please email izheleznyak @ citihabitats.com with your full name, profession, and business name. You may also post this information in the comments of this event. Please RSVP at least 24 hours before the meeting. 

We are specifically looking for a: 

CPA, Architect, Attorneys (Trusts & Estates, Matrimonial, Corporate, etc.), Property and Liability Insurance, Contractor, Photographer, Event Planner
results.how_to_find_us: 20 West 23rd St. 4th floor. Just buzz if door is locked
results.name: Structured Networking: People, Passion, and PROFIT!

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

STOP LETTING BUSINESS PASS YOU BY AND TAKE ACTION NOW!

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
NY/NJ Metro PDMA Chapter Event


A Professional Development Symposium

Tuesday, January 26, 2016, 8:30AM - 4:30PM @ The Grand Summit Hotel, Summit, NJ

Join PDMA and NYSCC (NY Society of Cosmetics Chemists) for a full day symposium on Product Development and Innovation

In today's fast paced environment, product designers recognize the challenges and risks of launching successful products that address customer needs and meet the bottom line on a continual basis.  At this one day joint conference, NY Society of Cosmetic Chemists & the Product Development Association--NY/NJ Chapter will explore the tools and techniques that product designers can use from the idea phase to the launch phase of the product planning process to ensure greater product success in the marketplace.  Business cases and examples will focus on the personal care / cosmetics industry.

Speakers and topics include:

Dr. Sharon Kennedy, Sr. Technical Associate, Colgate Palmolive:

Customer Focused Product Development: Designing the Right Product

Sandra Diaz, President, DIAZ & Co:

Multicultural Considerations for New Product Development

Stephen Birtsas, Senior Manager, Kalypso:

“Launch ‘em and Love ‘em” How to ensure ongoing success when your new product innovations hit the market

Steven Haines, CEO, Sequent Learning Networks:

The Business of Products – Linking Customers, Strategy, Ideas, and People

Dipanjan (DJ) Nag, President, IP Prediqtus, LLC:

Filling your pipeline through Open Innovation: Intellectual Property Strategy for Today's Business

Peter Duggan, Senior Vice President, Compushare:

Idea Generation - The Foundation of Product Development

In addition, you will have opportunities to network with participants from both PDMA and NYSCC during session breaks, lunch, and a post-event networking reception (all included with your registration fee).

Date:  Tuesday, January 26, 2016 (Snow Date: Tuesday, February 2, 2016)

Time:  8:30 – 4:30 PM with a cocktail reception beginning at 4:30 PM

Pricing (Register by January 19th):

PDMA Members: $35 

Non Members: $70 

Students: $10

Location: The Grand Summit Hotel 570 Springfield Avenue, Summit, NJ 07901

Note:

Register Now - Space is Limited! Lunch is included Includes two complimentary drinks at the closing reception

Advanced Registration Required

If you have any questions, please contact the Product Development and Management Association New York / New Jersey chapter at [masked]

About NYSCC:

The New York Society of Cosmetic Chemists is dedicated to the advancement of cosmetic science and strives to increase and disseminate scientific information through meetings and publications.  By promoting the research in cosmetic science and industry, and by setting high ethical, professional and educational standards, NYSCC reaches their goal of improving the qualifications of cosmetic scientists.

All requests for registration cancellation must be requested via email, before event registration closes.

Please contact Prashant Shah (973)[masked] or via email [masked] with any questions concerning this event.

</a>

For More Information and Registration:

<a href="http://www.pdma.org/p/cm/ld/fid=1940">http://www.pdma.org/p/cm/ld/fid=1940


6 PDCE Credits

results.description:
Join us if you'd like to be featured! 

Featuring:

Gabe Rives-Corbett was the first employee at untapt, where he is working on building a machine intelligence solution to technology hiring.  

Gabe spends most of his time at untapt trying to give computers a semantic understanding of resumes and other candidate data, and then have them use that knowledge to predict the best jobs for those candidates.  Techniques used include predictive modeling, named entity recognition, probabilistic topic modeling and more.  He’s also deeply involved in the tech stack which is python/flask and angularjs, as well as product development and user acquisition.  

Gabe graduated from NYU and joined untapt after a brief career in the theater.  He’s always excited to talk about untapt, as well as sailing, diving and strategies for Settlers of Catan. 

Downtown Tech Breakfast:

We'll do a round of introductions, followed by another round of questions for our featured guest. It's fun fast and interactive. Then we'll stay and chat as long as people like.

Recommended:

For more dining options with designers and entrepreneurs, check out:

http://www.meetup.com/Village-Tech-Breakfast/

http://www.meetup.com/UWS-Startup-Meetup/

http://www.meetup.com/Midtown-Tech-Breakfast/

http://www.meetup.com/Startup-Dim-Sum/
results.name: Breakfast w/ Gabe Rives-Corbett - Software Developer at untapt

results.description:
A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus.

Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.

• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps.

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!

• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show

• A great profile pic

So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Send us a profile picture too, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast on Saturday (soundboxonline.com). Also check out Carl J and ADG presents where you can find all of our mixes back. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.

Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G.

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.

Looking to develop speaking and leadership skills? Ace a job interview? Ignite your career? Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Our membership is 280,000 strong. Our members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 13,500 clubs like Bryant Park Toastmasters Club Membership in Manhattan

Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At Bryant Park Toastmasters we provide a safe environment to overcome fear, try new speaking tactics, or practice that upcoming sales presentation. Visit our website

MEETING TIME: Tuesday, 12:10pm to 1:15pm

VISITORS WELCOME: In order for you visit our club you need to register to this meeting and RSVP with your FULL NAME  AT MOST  SUNDA. Please arrive by Noon to allow extra time for security check-in.

** PHOTO ID a must!!

** Bring your confirmation email from a Bryant Park club member having added you to the security list is a must!! 


A Toastmasters Meeting always for follows the same agenda:

• Opening of the meeting by the president and presentation of the guests


• Welcoming by the Toastmaster of the Day and presentation of the watchtowers


• Speeches and Evaluations (up to 4)


• Club Business


• Table Topics Session - Guest can participate if they want to


• General Evaluation


• Closing of the meeting

results.description:
Do you ever feel like you either can’t get in touch with what you want, or can’t ask for it? 

Have you ever had that nagging feeling that much more is possible in your relationships and your intimacy but it continues to elude you?  Quality intimacy can fuel our energy levels, our happiness, our sense of purpose and connection, and can make it so much more pleasurable to enjoy life.  Yet we can't seem to hang on to those moments.  

What if there was a practice that could have you research intimacy.  To discover first hand where you don't ask for what you want, or clearly guide your partner to the space of more connection that you know and want?  

What if desire could be your compass and you could learn to lead your life based in desire rather than in fear? 

Margot Fried is a certified OneTaste Orgasmic Meditation trainer & Desire coach. 

Come for *FREE* 20 minutes Desire excavating sessions. You will talk about what you want, what is keeping you from having it, and at the end of the session Margot will make you an offer or suggestion to get on your path of following your desire. 

@ Joe and the Juice at noon on Tuesday. She will have a sign up sheet at her table at which you can reserve your spot. Slots will be First come First serve! So show up early to reserve one.
results.name: Get in Touch with Your Desire - Talk with a Desire Coach!

results.description:
I give a 'free', forever ongoing, astronomy class at the Senior Center.  You don't have to be a senior to join, but you must join the Senior Center for $72/year, which you can defer for at least a month, until you determine that you want to continue.

I never give the same lecture twice.  It would bore me.  My lectures are well prepared, and contain enormous resources from the live web, projected from my laptop to a flat screen TV.  It's all about gaining a perspective of your/my place in the universe.

==================

The class meets Tuesdays at 12:45pm.  Just come.  241 W 72st.  Ask for Laird.  (As of August, 2014, as well as for the last 5 years.)

To make sure the class isn't cancelled (it normally meets every week of the year), please email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in the email.  (It gets sorted away from my inbox.)
results.why: Astronomy is about EVERYTHING.  Or at least thats why I became interested in it in 2nd grade.  Now, 40 years post Ph.D. in Astronomy, Astronomy, and indeed all of science is still my passion.   My advisor was Carl Sagan.
results.how_to_find_us: Email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in your email.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

This is a webinar.

 You can participate online from any computer or web-enabled device.

This event is free to attend (virtually)  and participate in.

In order to participate, you must register here  to receive log in info:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-webinar-opening-of-the-h-1b-visa-cap-are-you-ready-tickets-20840015046 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/3633912687629843970 

The new H-1B visa cap will open on April 1, 2016.  This webinar by Capitol Immigration Law Group will discuss the best strategies for employers to prepare for and maximize their chances for a successful H-1B cap season 

The speakers will review the H-1B application process from the employer's perspective and will provide corporate strategies and timelines for filing before the cap is hit.  

The speakers will discuss:

1) how to document third party work sites and clients, including preparing for site visits and scrutiny

2) what kind of documentation is required for in-house projects

3)  how to evaluate H-1B cap candidates and their educational and experience credentials

4) which job positions are considered specialty occupations

5) how to minimize (or eliminate) chances of RFEs/NOID

6) how to address OPT/CPT F-1 student concerns - cap-gap, travel and more

7) how to avoid common mistakes

and more!

Dimo R. Michailov, Esq.

As one of the senior attorneys and the founding member of the Capitol Immigration Law Group, Mr. Michailov is at the forefront of the immigration law community. He represents individuals from more than 50 countries in their quest for U.S. immigration options and solutions. He also represents companies and organizations ranging from small entrepreneurs to multinational corporations in meeting their goals to recruit, hire and retain talented foreign nationals while maintaining full compliance with the relevant immigration rules and procedures.

results.description:
Microsoft Office Hours are a block of time set aside to allow Windows 10, mobile, cloud & IoT developers to work on their apps/games and get some help and guidance from on-site Microsoft Technical Evangelists. This is also a great opportunity to work on your own projects alongside like-minded developers, away from distractions and work interruptions.

Typical guidance offered during office hours includes:

• Pre-vetting of your startup or indie activities for the Microsoft BizSpark program.

• Technical guidance for mobile developers on Windows 10 & Windows Mobile, or using Xamarin.iOS, Xamarin.Android, Cordova/PhoneGap. This is a great opportunity to get help as you build new Universal apps now that Windows 10 is here.

• Technical guidance for cross-platform developers on Windows, iOS or Android looking to leverage Microsoft Azure within their app or games. IoT makers are also welcome for guidance on Azure connectivity.

• Promotional guidance for mobile developers looking to drive more downloads, market and monetize their app or game.

• User testing of your latest app or game with Microsoft and other attendees.

• On-Site device testing of your latest app or game on various Windows devices, such as Lumia phones or Surface tablets. Make sure to post a comment specifying which devices(s) you'd like to test on. Not all devices will be available every time.

• Get functional feedback on how to improve the overall functionality of your app or game.

• Get user experience (UX) and usability feedback on how to improve the overall aesthetics and workflow of your app or game.

Microsoft Office Hours are open to everyone looking for some time and help to finish their project before publishing, or work on driving more downloads for their apps and games. Formal presentations are not held during office hours and these events will remain unstructured. Office hours open at 1:00PM but feel free to arrive when you want. If you have any questions about office hours, feel free to ask below. We also recommend that you stick around for the monthly evening presentation.

Note to Makers: If you plan on working on IoT gadgets, just remember that this is a corporate office, not a maker space. Soldering and power tools are not allowed,

Your name must be added to the building security list so please RSVP and do not show-up unannounced. Since there is a limited number of seats, please keep your RSVP up-to-date. If you RSVP'd and cannot make it, change your RSVP to "no".

FINAL NOTE: Microsoft Office Hours are about guidance, learning, sharing & testing. This is not a premier-level technical support service. If you have some esoteric bug or technical issue for which you cannot find any help online, don't expect miracles during office hours. This is why StackOverflow exists :)

results.description:
This will be our afternoon of Fun and Games, Good Food, Drinks,  and Socializing.  And for many of us a new experience while learning something new.  While  in the process of researching Pool ( billiards) Halls. I found that we have lots of choices.  From the village to the upper East side. From the posh to the putrid.  From the high priced ($10.50 an hour), to the low priced ($ 5.00 per hour). 

Amsterdam's Billiards  has been most often recommended  as a good place to meet up.    It is upscale , big, with a full bar and good food, and music....  Check it out online ...    It looks like a fun place....  WHEN WAS THE LAST TIME THAT YOU CAME OUT TO PLAY???    There are other games to play besides pool.  (ping pong, darts, etc..)  The food and drinks get good reviews also so .....What more could we ask for .  KNOCK, KNOCK, KNOCK.....(ASK YOURSELF): CAN YOU COME OUT AND PLAY???.....

From the response so far it looks like a lot of you need to give your  "young" hearts some vitamin C,  or  ....  a stiff shot of adrenalin...............  Doing new things, and meeting new people in our age group is so important for us Senior Citizens.  As we keep losing our old friends  - one by one - and we keep losing our youthful abilities - one by one-  they need to be replaced.  Finding new friends and new activities is critical........Don't let your world shrink and dry up.....We can rescue each other !!!!

I know absolutely nothing about playing pool BUT...... I  love to learn new things.  Please give me some feed back concerning your thoughts. Please include how much, or little you know about playing pool. 

 We will go during the week, during the daytime.  It seems  the places are not crowded,..... and the prices are also lower. 

LADIES:....   in an effort to inspire more men to attend our meetups...... I hope you will be adventurous enough to step into their comfort zone (for a change), and enjoy the experience while perhaps learning something new.

MEN: ....pleas let me know that you will be on board to help the women (like myself)  who don't have much of a clue.  (the novice).....  you don't have to be a pro but at least you might know some of the rules.

Give me your 2 cents... and get ready for  a poker party, fishing, baseball, botchy, hiking, etc.  coming down the pike!!

Remember to look for me wearing my ORANGE HEADBAND with the ribbons and a flower.  I am so excited....see you there!!

To reserve your place, register: https://nyspin201601.eventbrite.com/?aff=nyspinmeetup

Most code can be revised, since whether it changes internally or not has little impact on outsiders. Applications Programming Interfaces (APIs) are different; they are the quintessential “outside face,” providing outside groups with the contract for interaction. In both technology and biology, internal mechanisms evolve; interfaces are conserved. If new and improved interfaces never supplant established interfaces, how can both new and improved interfaces continue to coexist?  Release is merely the first step of a gradual, painful, never-ending process. Complete replacement is never achieved. We will examine this issue and ways to avoid "rebooting" APIs.

Even more fundamentally, there are a variety of issues which must be addressed when defining an API. Many teams bog down on questions of mere syntax (e.g... JSON vs. XML) rather than the far more fundamental questions of interface semantics (e.g., policy issues). In the long-term, questions of syntax have relatively little relevance. Questions of semantics (e.g., what constitutes a valid request, is a request proper, are there appropriate security and integrity measures) are far more critical.


Robert Gezelter

has worked the design of protocols and interfaces since the late 1970's. He has been responsible for the architecture, design, and implementation of protocols and interfaces at the device, software, network, and applications levels, both locally on a particular system and remotely over a variety of network layers and stacks, including over HTTP/HTTPS and similar protocols. He has over 31 years of experience consulting on Information Technology matters and is a Contributing Editor of the "Computer Security Handbook, 6th Edition" (Spring 2014).

Mr. Gezelter has also spoken and published extensively on operating systems, networks, performance, security, tools, and similar areas. Since 1985, he has spoken worldwide for organizations including ACM, Connect (previously Encompass/DECUS), ISSA, ISACA, and IEEE. He was appointed to the IEEE Computer Society's Distinguished Visitors Program for a three-year term in 2004. Mr. Gezelter holds BA and MS degrees in Computer Science from New York University. He has been a Contributing Editor to the "Computer Security Handbook" since the 3rd Edition (1995), and contributed to the Handbook of Information Security (2005).

Mr. Gezelter is in private practice, with clients ranging from the Fortune10 to small businesses, both locally and internationally. He maintains his offices in Flushing, New York. He can be contacted via http://www.rlgsc.com.

From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension

Can you achieve true GIF superiority?  Come join us for the launch of:


Postlight. We build big, serious web and mobile applications for media, finance, healthcare, and real estate. We also do some ridiculous experiments on the side.


Which is why we want you to come have a few drinks and meet GIFBATTLE, a new experiment by Postlight. What's GIFBATTLE? GIFBATTLE, friend, is a celebration of the art of trash-talking using only animated GIFs.


What's the best part of Slack, Flowdock, or Twitter? Animated GIFs. What's the worst part? All the boring talk about work. So we asked ourselves, what would it look like if we just got rid of the talk and focused on just the GIFs? And then we built that. And it worked. And then we gamified it because why the hell not? It took a couple weeks. It's pretty awesome.


WHAT? WHY? WHO? HOW? Whatever. Come drink at our offices and challenge a friend to a GIFBattle on the big screen. Meet the team. See the future of all human conversation. Have a few drinks. Compete. Win. Lose. Go home and challenge your friends to more GIFBattles. Win and lose some more. Live a happier and more fulfilled life.

It'll be DUMB FUN FOR SMART PEOPLE. See you soon.
results.name: Join us for the launch of GIFBATTLE!

results.description:
40+ RSVPs through Eventbrite so far - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/daniel-markovitz-mbalecturer-stanford-university-building-the-fit-organization-tickets-19787258222

Dozens of management fads have come (and gone) over the past few decades, but there’s one approach that has delivered the desired results consistently, year after year: the Toyota Production System (also known as “lean.”) However, most companies approach lean wrong, and as a result, the corporate landscape is littered with the carcasses of organizations that have failed in their pursuit of the Toyota Way. 

Their efforts fail precisely because they’re trying to copy Toyota. What leaders need to do instead is learn from Toyota—learn how to convert their competent organizations into dynamic, constantly improving, profoundly customer-focused entities. A “fit” organization has the ability to continually improve in a manner that delivers superior performance and results over the long haul. 

This workshop, based on the new book, "Building the Fit Organization," distills the lessons from the Toyota Production System into six core concepts, and couches them in the easily understandable language of physical fitness and athletic excellence. By the end of the talk, you’ll have a good idea of how to go about making your organization faster, more competitive, and better able to win in your market. 

Maximize your organization's effectiveness

The three major components for enhancing your organization's effectiveness are strategy, culture, and leadership. Regardless of size, industry, product/service, or geography, these three components--if done well--will propel your organization forward. We will discuss these three topics, which I call the titanium triangle, and how you can use them to maximize your organization's potential. 

Agenda:

6-6:30 PM Brett's Presentation about Maximizing Your Organization's Effectiveness

6:30-6:45 PM Q & A with Brett

6:45-7:30 PM Daniel's Presentation on Building a Fit Organization

7:30-7:45 PM Q & A with Daniel

7:45-8 PM Networking
results.name: Daniel Markovitz MBA/Lecturer Stanford University: Building the Fit Organization

results.description:
[REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE]

Come to the First Start-up Showcase of 2016: Game-changing Technologies in Mobile Advertising and Marketing

Sponsored by: Shutterstock


A major challenge for every marketer and advertiser is how to capture the attention and engagement of consumers on small screens held by highly goal-oriented folks with short attention spans.  Adding to that, they don’t want to be “marketed to” unless the experience organically serves their goals or resonates with them personally. In this environment, how can marketers deliver relevant content to the right consumers at the right moments?

This event features 5 early-stage companies who have been vetted by our team of industry experts to offer technology-based solutions to this exact quandary. VCs, major media players and marketers will benefit by learning about these upstart companies and getting a chance to assess the value of their technologies.

Our panel of expert judges include prominent VCs and industry leaders in the digital media space.

Neil S. Carty, Senior Vice President, Innovation Strategy at MediaLink

Marketing and Innovation Strategy professional with 15+ years of experience in innovation strategy ,communications planning, business planning and consumer insight. Work has spanned across a variety of sectors including Fortune 500 companies, challenger brands, as well as the non-profit sector.

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com

results.description:
OVERVIEW

Windows 10 is now installed on over 200 million computers and devices. Come learn how to build Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with an adaptive UI that spans screens from 4" to 80".

EVENING DETAILS

6:00PM - Doors open, head to the Radio City room on the 6th floor.

6:30PM - Introduction by the host, housekeeping, sponsors,

6:45PM - Main presentation begins (see abstract below).

After the talk - Prize raffle courtesy of Microsoft, Telerik, O'Reilly Media, and other sponsors.

Your RSVP is required to add your name to the building security guest list. Please keep your RSVP up-to-date should you find yourself unable to come.

MAIN PRESENTATION

Build Adaptive UIs for Phones, Tablets, Desktops, Xbox, and More

Windows 10 is the final destination for the convergence of “One Windows across all devices”, allowing you to build for every device running Windows 10 (phones, tablets, desktops, Xbox, HoloLens and more) with one project.  With quite an array of devices and form factors, an Adaptive UI is necessary to provide the optimum capabilities and user experience for each.  Microsoft has gone a long way to provide new tooling and controls to help you do just that, ensuring that your customers have a great experience regardless of device.  Join me as we explore new features, XAML controls, and APIs for developers in the Universal Windows Platform and Visual Studio to help you build a UI that adapts to so many devices.

ABOUT THE PRESENTER

James Quick – Technical Evangelist, Microsoft

James Quick is an avid technologist who specializes in Mobile, 2D Game Development, and Cloud . James studied Computer Science and Spanish at Vanderbilt University where he found his love for mobile through creating his very first application, a Harry Potter Trivia Game .  Upon graduation, he joined Microsoft as the Technical Evangelist in South Florida and has since continued on to New York City. 

During his time at Microsoft, he has been an active member of the tech community working with  various community groups, organizations, and schools.  Finding a particular interest in EDU through working with the Miami Dade STEM Board, leading professional development training for high school teachers and college professor, and being in numerous classrooms throughout South Florida and NYC.  James has led workshops and given talks on a regular basis at various meetup and community groups.  James has also spoken at other such as Code Camps (Boston, NYC, South Florida), ITPalooza, NYC Camp, and more.  James also has a very active online presence through his blog, Github, twitter, etc.

TO ALL INVENTORS WITH THAT GREAT "IDEA"YOUR INVITED TO "PITCH A PRODUCT™".  ANDREA ROSE® & HER PARTNERS ARE LOOKING FOR THAT NEXT GREAT PRODUCT TO BRING TO MARKET!!

We are excited to announce at ‘The Inventors Road Show™” our new workshop “Pitch a Product™”.   Award winning inventor Andrea Rose® will facilitate the evening helping the group  learn how to present their products to market while on the lookout for that next “Winning” product to introduce to her marketing partners that include such companies as  "As Seen On TV , mass retailers. international distributors and television home shopping companies to name a few. 

Attendees will have “5 minutes” to pitch their inventions to the group.  This workshop helps inventors learn how to present their “Ideas to Industry™”.  It also helps them discover how to look at their inventions as a solution to a problem that is needed in the marketplace.  To have a successful  “product/invention”  it must fill a need in the marketplace and this workshop explores this very important aspect of inventing. 

NOTE:   Andrea Rose® is an award winning inventor who has alliances with companies that provide services to inventors.  She will be providing the group with her expert advice and looking for the next great invention to present to her marketing partners. Andrea does one on one consulting for inventors who are seeking personalize assistance.  For more information contact:  [masked]

(From time to time there will be surprise guests who will join Andrea Rose® at the workshops. This week our guest speaker will be Alan Brody  founder of IBreakfast, Startupalooza, "Angel Week" and author of Are You Fundable?)

DISCLAIMER:  Andrea Rose® is not an attorney and does not provide any legal advice to any inventor. All inventors  pitching and presenting their inventions in the workshop should have filed for a provisional patent, have a patent-pending or an issued patent if they choose to participate in giving a pitch to the group.  Otherwise their idea could loose the legal  protection that is provided by filing for a patent.  It will be at the discretion of the inventor if they want to pitch their product.

results.description:
Tuesday is Arduino night at Fat Cat Fab Lab!

We have lots more Arduinos, breadboards, and parts, so bring your laptop and come join us for a fun hands-on learning experience.

Tuesday January 19th was our second Fat Cat Fab Lab Arduino Tuesday and here is what happened:


The Windows users fared well and didn't have difficulty connecting their laptops to the $4.00 Chinese Arduino UNO R3s that we had that use the CH340 USB interface chip.   They proceeded to hookup LEDs and switches a run simple programs interfacing with them.

The Mac users on the other hand had a frustrating night.  They were not able to connect to the UNO R3 Arduinos we had.  ( They were however able to connect to the one  Official Arduino UNO that one of our attendees had. )


A Google search pointed to websites with Mac drivers for the CH340 USB chip, but users were not willing to trust the security of the websites providing the drivers.

I have since researched the topic, successfully installed the CH340 drivers on my MacBook Air, and put detailed documentation on a webpage here.


The people who didn't bring their laptops were relegated to observing.   Get it!  Bring your laptop if you want to get into the action.


Everyone learned that: you don't get very far without having the correct driver to match the Arduino you have and the Operating Systems on your laptop.  After the meeting we had success: Fat Cat Fab Lab resident-maker Peter Hartman was able to trackdown the website of the manufacturer of the CH430 chip and download a driver from their website that worked on his Mac with our UNO R3s.  Next week everyone will get connected.


If you are interested in learning more about Arduino, please come an join us next Arduino Tuesday.


--------------------------------------------------------------

Stewart Newfeld, our Arduino Tuesdays host has a an Electrical Engineering degree from Rutgers University, years of industry experience, and loves to teach and share his enthusiasm for making things. He enjoys ordering those so-inexpensive electronic parts from ebay and Aliexpress and having them show up like little toys two to three weeks later in his mailbox. He is president of Zebra Systems, Inc. where he develops websites with the Joomla Open Source CMS.

--------------------------------------------------------------

results.description:
USE THIS LINK TO REGISTER:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/poverty-inc-filmmaker-qa-dri-nyu-tickets-19864161241?aff=ebrowse

_________________________________________________

This event is NOT hosted by the BTFC, you must use the link above to register.

For all those interested in documentary filmmaking, the Development Research Institute at NYU will host a screening of the award winning documentary, Poverty, Inc., in Jurow Lecture Hall at 6 PM. There will be a reception following the screening along with a Q&A discussion.

Watch the film trailer: https://vimeo.com/109863354

Website: http://www.povertyinc.org/

POVERTY, INC. has earned 40 international film festival honors and was recently selected to the "Best of Fests" category in IDFA Amsterdam - the biggest documentary festival in the world. It has already screened in 16 countries and numerous top universities, sparking a fast-growing grassroots dialogue to ignite change around the world.

FILM SYNOPSIS

“I see multiple colonial governors,” says Ghanaian software entrepreneur Herman Chinery-Hesse of the international development establishment in Africa. “We are held captive by the donor community.”

The West has positioned itself as the protagonist of development, giving rise to a vast multi-billion dollar poverty industry — the business of doing good has never been better.

Yet the results have been mixed, in some cases even catastrophic, and leaders in the developing world are growing increasingly vocal in calling for change. Drawing from over 200 interviews filmed in 20 countries, Poverty, Inc. unearths an uncomfortable side of charity we can no longer ignore.

From TOMs Shoes to international adoptions, from solar panels to U.S. agricultural subsidies, the film challenges each of us to ask the tough question: Could I be part of the problem?
results.name: Award-Winning Doc "Poverty, Inc": Screening and Q&A

group.name: The Black TV and Film Collective

results.description:
January FinTech Happy Hour in partnership with our friends at Startupbootcamp FinTech.

Startupbootcamp FinTech is the leading accelerator focused on financial innovation. We provide funding, mentorship, office space in the heart of Manhattan and access to a global network of corporate partners, mentors, investors and VCs, for up to 10 selected FinTech startups across the globe. 

Startupbootcamp FinTech is backed by Mastercard, Rabobank, Thomson Reuters and Santander to provide the expertise, exposure channels, and access to a network of industry professionals that most early-stage fintech startups would not be able to access otherwise.

To learn more about the program please visit our website: http://startupbootcamp.org/accelerator/fintech-new-york.html.  We are also holding a FastTrack Pitch Event in New York on Feb 10.  Apply to pitch here: http://goo.gl/iLFacS.

results.description:
In the Fall of 2008, Stephen Lyman walked into a Japanese pub in Chelsea called Izakaya Ten. That's the night he discovered shochu and everything has changed since then. Shochu Tuesday became a thing among he and his friends. Sadly, izakaya Ten closed last year, but Juban has opened in its place with an updated decor and slightly updated menu, but the same cool, chill vibe of the original. Stephen will make his bartending debut at Juban on January 26th. It'll be nostalgiac and a new beginning all at once.

Have you tried shochu? The traditional distilled spirit from Japan? It's more dry than sake and much easier to drink than other spirits. Goes great when paired with food.

Stephen Lyman, editor of http://kampai.us and shochu sommelier for SakaMai and other NYC Japanese restaurants, pours selected shochu each Tuesday around NYC. The location will be on the move so stay on top of each week here on meetup or by following Stephen on twitter @kampaius
results.name: Juban'sday: where it all began

results.description:
Who would be bold enough to take on Crest and Colgate, and market a new toothpaste? It’s Craig Dubitsky, founder and CEO of hello products, which you’ve no doubt seen at Target and elsewhere. 

Craig will tell us how he recognizes opportunities (including in what would seem to be a mature market like toothpaste) and then successfully brings them to market. That’s what entrepreneurship is all about!

Craig, whose Hello company is based in Montclair, was also a co-founder of eos products, famous for its now ubiquitous spherical lip balm, and was a founding board member of Method Products, the green-cleaning company that’s a mainstay at Target.

Craig was named by AdAge as one of the 50 Most Creative People of 2014, where he described himself as ADD—Always Dreaming in Design. Inc. Magazine named hello to its Most Audacious Companies list as one of the 25 Companies That Are Changing the World, and eatbigfish named hello as one of the Challenger Brands to Watch two years running.

To learn more about Dubitsky, visit his LinkedIn profile and his company website. On Twitter: @cdubitsky


Event is co-sponsored with Residence Life.


Agenda:
6:00-6:45 p.m. Networking with pizza
6:45-7:00 p.m. Welcome and 1-minute pitches from the audience
7:00-7:25 p.m. Craig Dubitsky presentation
7:25-7:45 p.m. Student team pitches, with Dubitsky feedback
7:45-8:30 p.m. Audience Q&A with Dubitsky

Directions and parking info: Park in the Red Hawk Deck on campus, exit the deck on Level 5 and proceed straight up the walkway (soccer field will be on your left) to the new School of Business building. Link to campus map with directions is available on this web page.


Join the conversation on Twitter and Instagram: #MSUmeetup and @FelicianoCenter

results.description:
Join us at the first NJ Music Networking Mixer of 2016! We have a great new location with our own separate party room. 


Come to socialize with fellow music industry people -  musicians, bloggers, producers, label execs, DJs, graphic designers, photographers, and others.

Meet. Mingle. Make new friends. Be inspired. Network. Learn new things!

GIFT BAGS! 
We are putting together gift bags for attendees. If you have any promotional items, stickers, download cards, business cards, flyers, etc. that you would like to include in these bags so that everyone goes home with your stuff, please contact any of the organizers of this event so we can provide you with information as to how you can send it in.

MUSIC SAMPLERS! 
We are also putting together music samplers to include in the gift bags so if you have any new music that you would like to include on the sampler, message an organizer and we'll send you the upload link. 

RSVPs REQUIRED
Since this is a networking event, and people often attend specifically to meet people who do certain things, we require all attendees to RSVP for the event. Also, because we have our own party space reserved, attendance is limited to the capacity of the room. So your name must be on the guest list to attend.  

PLUS ONES
There are no plus ones on the guest list. We encourage you to bring along other industry-related professionals who should RSVP as a separate attendee. Because the goal of this event is to have a chance to meet and mingle with new people, we kindly request that non-music related plus ones are kept to a minimum because we have found that it discourages interaction among members. If you absolutely must bring a non-music plus one, they must be RSVP'd as a separate attendee.  

PLEASE NOTE:  
This is not a performance event or a jam session so there's no need to bring instruments or gear. There are other Meetup groups that specialize in that kind of thing. This event is an opportunity for exchanging ideas, information, and meeting other music people. 

We look forward to seeing you again! Or meeting you for the first time! 

SPONSORS
Want to be a sponsor? Contact us.
results.name: NJ Music Industry Networking Mixer

results.description:
This week I am going to see The 5th Wave I will arrive at 6:15 for the 6:40 pm showing. I  have seat E11 If you are coming post your seat # We can meet in lobby after the show in case anyone wants to go to the diner after.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Thur/Fri) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it. 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to driver there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

 Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

ABOUT TiE NEW YORK

TiE is a non-profit, global community welcoming entrepreneurs from all over the world. We believe in the power of ideas to change the face of entrepreneurship and growing business through our five pillars; mentoring, networking, education, incubating and funding. TiE was founded in 1992 by a group of successful entrepreneurs and is currently the world’s largest entrepreneurial organization out there. With programs like TiE Young Entrepreneurs (TYE) and Mentor Match, TiE is reaching out and fostering the next generation of entrepreneurs.

We help entrepreneurs go global. As a TIE member, you are connected with over 11,000 members across 61 chapters. Wherever in the world you are, meet leaders, attend events and participate in unique speaking opportunities. From outsourcing advice to global business development, TIE has you covered.

Being a TIE member is your gateway to global business. Join today.

Learn the basics about Distressed Mortgage Note investing.  If you are new to the business or own a few loans this seminar will be great.  Of course, for the experienced note buyers, it is always a good idea to stay connected with the note community. 

How can you generate great passive CASHFLOW?

Why are these notes available? What is a Mortgage? What is a Note? How do you know if the loan has been assigned to you?  

These are just some of the topics that will be covered and we will hold an open Q&A at the end of each meetup.  Our goal is that you understand this information well enough that you will be able to apply it on future purchases or with your existing portfolio.

results.description:
For those who missed the December meeting, we mentioned how important it was to watch the first four trading days of the year because they provide an indication of how the rest of the year might go for stocks. Based on this criterion, things don't look good so far since they have had the biggest sell off in history during this period in 2016. 


We will be discussing the prospects for stocks, bonds, currencies and commodities. While stocks look like they're potentially in big trouble, commodities are already extremely cheap and have been in a bottoming process for some time. The time to buy them should be some time this year, perhaps soon. 

Date/Time: Wednesday, January 20th, 6:30-8:30 PM
Place: 420 Lexington Ave (at 43rd St), 15th Floor 
Admission: $10

AGENDA:


6:30-6:40 Daryl Montgomery: Introduction to Group

6:40-7:05 David Harris, PhD: What is the market topping/bottoming market saying now? 

7:05-7:20 Kelly Killian:  Real Estate Market: Does it look like 2008?


7:20 -7:30 Intermission

7:30-8:30 Daryl Montgomery: Update on Stocks, Bonds, Currencies, and Commodities

Beyond your typical dance fitness class! Groovefit World Dance is for those that have done Zumba, Cize, and other dance based workouts but need more than the same choreograph over and over every week! All GWD classes have real dance steps with routines that are easy to follow. We shake it up with Samba, Salsa, merengue, west African, hip hop, reggae, Bollywood, belly dance and more! No two classes are ever the same. All levels are welcome. We will meet Tuesday's at 6:30p at Pearl Studios: 500 8th avenue, room 409.

Come ready to "dance for the sweat of it!"

Your dance ambassador,

Jannelle Cortes

Come join our board game Facebook group to stay in touch.
