results.description:
Have you had makgeolli?


Makgeolli is milky, sweet, sometimes slightly carbonated Korean traditional alcoholic beverage made with rice. Back in the old days, each household would brew this delicious drink at home and have its own house recipe passed down from generation to generation. This tradition had been lost in the near century, but the Korean’s love of alcohol is bringing back the makgeolli back to the market. Makgeolli is simple to make at home with few ingredients and equipment. This is a rare opportunity to learn about Korean traditional drinks and how to brew makgeolli from a new artisan from Korea!

Class Schedule:

6:30 pm   Light refreshment and mulled makgeolli
7:00 pm   Introduction to makgeolli & brewing
8:00 pm   Tasting 4 different craft brews & mingle
9:00 pm   Wrap up

<a href="http://www.ykan.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/20150215_130719.jpg"></a> What you get during the class:

* introduction to makgeolli and brewing
* recipe
* nuruk (Korean yeast)
* sweet rice
* water
* Reusable fermentation jar
* pajeon
* 4 different handcrafted brews for tasting

Everyone gets to take home about 1/2 gallon of original form of takju or 1 gallon of makgeolli.

What: [yKAN/KALAGNY] Makgeolli (rice wine) Making Workshop

When: Tuesday, January 26, 2016 @ 6:30 – 9:00 pm

Where: NY DokSeoSil (5th Floor Gallery)
312 5th Ave (between 32 & 31 str)

Cost: Early Bird – $50 (till 1/19/16)
General Admission – $60
No walk-ins

RSVP: Reserve your tickets online (must be aged 21 or over to register).
https://makgeolliwkshp.eventbrite.com
results.name: Makgeolli (rice wine) Making Workshop

please note that we may be on the 7th or the 8th floor. so go to both floors until you find us.

if you have any questions call or text me:

Anton[masked]

My email: [masked]


The meetup:

We are specifically focused on projects that need funding and people who have funds and are looking for deals.  Everyone is welcome to come, but investors and entrepreneurs are preferred. Based on past meetups, we have ran out of space and time before, so there will be a maximum of 10 people presenting. presenters are on a first come first serve basis. 

As usual the meetup is broken up in to 3 parts

Part 1 is meet and greet

Part 2 is deal presentations

Part 3 is mingle

Presentations will now be strictly limited to 5 minutes + 2 minutes Q&A

To pitch your deal. You can bring any supporting information including, PowerPoint, video, handouts, ect... If you need assistance setting up in advance please let me know 1-2 days in advance.

We have no restrictions on what kind of deals you want to present, anything goes.


ps; as before I will gather all attendees information and email it to everyone at the end of the meetup.

results.description:
Meet and network with startups and marketing colleagues, entrepreneurs, and decision-makers from a cross-section of industries, companies, and levels. Marketers from the following companies have attended in the past: Pepsi, L'Oreal, Pernod Ricard, Procter & Gamble, Colgate Palmolive, Rosetta, Young & Rubicam, Ogilvy, Havas, Thomson Reuters, Bloomingdale's, MTV, and American Express. 

Join us on Tuesday, January 26th from 6:30pm - 8:30pm at Build Grand Central, part of Grand Central Tech. In addition to our standard happy hour, throughout the event, you'll be able to check out exhibition stations from various New York tech startups. We'll be providing free wine. FoodtoEat will be providing delicious hors d'oeuvres.

Because we're hosting it at Grand Central Tech, the building's security requires us to submit a list of the names of all attendees. Unfortunately, that means no walk-ins will be allowed and you must RSVP online by 3:30pm the day of the event. You'll be asked to provide your full name and email address when you RSVP for this event.

Meet the Exhibiting Startups 
We'll be adding startups to the list below as we get closer to the event. If you would like to recommend any that would be appropriate, feel free to contact us at [masked]

- Uncubed equips a fast-growing community with the digital skills, insight, and experiences needed to succeed at modern work. Our learning platform delivers online classes taught by leaders at top startups. We take you to the offices of today’s fastest-growing companies to learn the skills they’re leveraging to build industry-changing products. Wakefield, Uncubed’s daily editorial, is a must-read for anyone interested in tech and digital. And our event experiences build your network, your skills, and maybe even land you a new job.


- Trustpilot is a global, multi-language, open review community that builds trust and transparency between consumers and businesses. Boasting more than 15 million consumer reviews of 115,000 businesses, Trustpilot produces a TrustScore for businesses based on recent reviews. Every day, more than 10,000 consumers sign up on Trustpilot.com, and every month, 500,000 new reviews are posted on the community. Trustpilot has customers in 65 countries and has offices in New York, London, Copenhagen, Berlin and Melbourne.

- Pandora has much to offer for marketers and consumers, which means increased ability to offer new ways of experiences. Enabling brands to deliver more value to their audiences and create much more impactful interactions using Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality technologies.

- Instapanel lets you collect video feedback from your users, consumers, customers, and employees.

Remember to join our email list and follow us on Twitter. 


About Croud 
</a><a href="http://croud.com/">Croud is a performance digital marketing agency founded in the UK in July 2011, now ranked number 4 in Google’s Top 10 UK Independent Agencies. Croud launched in the US in late 2015 to support work on its US-based clients, including Netflix, Net-a-Porter, Regus, and Etsy, and to establish the agency as a major global player. Croud now employs 70 people globally across offices in New York, London, Shrewsbury, and Sydney but is powered in the back end by Croudies, its very own network of over 350 on-demand digital marketing professionals. This network allows the company to do more optimization per account than any other agency on the planet.


About FoodtoEat 
FoodtoEat is a marketplace for companies to get catering from the best restaurants, food trucks and caterers. We impact the way people eat in the workplace by collaborating with the local food community to provide mindful food experiences. We strive to help amazing companies feed their talented employees because we believe that investing in your team is the best investment a company can make. Learn more: www.foodtoeat.com/p/catering

About Grand Central Tech  
Grand Central Tech is a community of startups and strategic partners that breaks from the traditional accelerator model by providing an unparalleled value proposition. Accepted companies will receive FREE office space for a YEAR with ZERO equity fee to participate. To support these companies, we have assembled an incredible group of Strategic Advisors, Mentors, Corporate Partners, Growth Partners, and Educational Institutions.

results.description:
If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. No prior reading or experience required to attend. You can leave early as we usually do this every half hour. Gotham Writer's Workshop charges $25 for this. Cost of this meetup? Free.

Jessica

<a>[masked]</a>

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.
results.name: Just Write!

results.description:
Join us for an incredible private wine tasting with several different social groups. We will meet in a private wine cellar and taste wines from all over the world. We will have both red and white wines along with light appetizers.

There will also be detailed written tasting notes and the ability to purchase similar wines in an adjacent wine store at a special discount.

If you're new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all. This is such a fun wine tasting that sells out every time!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Jan-26-2016_at_0630PM 

Tickets start are just $29 (goes up to $39 as event gets closer).  

Can I come alone? Yes 90% attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work. It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages? This is non-age specific event. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Jan-26-2016_at_0630PM

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work. It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages? This is non-age specific event. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Jan-26-2016_at_0630PM

results.description:
Have you been overwhelmed by all the theme and plugin choices available?  Have you downloaded or purchased a theme only to be frustrated and disappointed?  Are you questioning the cost of a paid theme or plugin? 

Picking a theme and plugins for your website is difficult enough.  On top of that when you choose a paid theme or plugin and it isn’t what you expected you feel like you wasted both money and time!

In this presentation we will examine how the right ‘premium’ WordPress tools can save you both time and money.

We’re going to review a great looking website built using the Genesis theme and the Beaver Builder plugin.  Beaver Builder is a new and exciting drag-and-drop page builder plugin that works flawlessly with Genesis to quickly build beautiful well coded and Google friendly websites.

Genesis is a premium theme supported by a large community of developers, designers and bloggers with more than twenty five companies providing child themes and more than eighty free plugins, created specifically for Genesis, available from the WordPress repository.  Not to mention all the free tweaks, tips and tricks freely available on the internet.

Come join us to learn

- Why the premium (paid) Genesis theme may be the ‘cheaper’ option

- Why the Genesis theme framework is so popular

- Why there are scores of Genesis specific plugins

- Where to find hundreds of Genesis child themes

- Why Genesis is so popular with developers and designers

- How to use the pre-built Beaver builder modules to quickly assemble a great looking website

- Why Beaver Builder is different than most other drag-and-drop page builders

This is a must-see presentation whether you’re a pro or a WordPress novice.


Agenda: 

6:30-6:45 Networking 
6:45-7:00 Lighting Round (general questions about WP) 
7:00-7:45 Presentation & Questions 
7:45-8:00 Final Group Networking 

Our Speaker 

Tevye Brown, a New York City native living in Rockland the CMO of BroVera Systems has been a software developer for longer than he cares to mention.  For the last six years Tevye has been focusing on using WordPress and Genesis to develop websites for local businesses.
results.name: Build a good looking, professional website fast - Genesis and Beaver Builder

results.description:
Brett Camper and Peter Richardson of Mapzen will present Tangram, a map renderer designed to grant you ludicrous levels of control over your map design.

Using WebGL, Tangram saddles and rides your graphics card into a new world of cartographic exploration. Animated shaders, 3D buildings, and dynamic filtering can be combined to produce effects normally seen only in science fiction.
results.name: Mapzen Tangram: Real-time Map Design, Display and Interactivity using WebGL

results.description:
NYC Councilmatic (nyc.councilmatic.org) is a new website for tracking and commenting on everything in the NYC Council. Site creator David Moore will demo how Councilmatic connects visitors to official government info, with the ability to add comments to any item of NYC legislation. We’ll walk through the process of researching data-energy issues on the platform, and identifying key points of contact in the city council to advance smart cities initiatives. Also: we’ll discuss how open standards for legislative information can help cities spread best practices and analyze policy, and how forthcoming alert features could be best designed to keep Smart Cities attendees up-to-date when their issues are on the agenda in committee hearings. Overall, it’s open city data + crowdsourced policy, working towards a vision of continual conversation and expert input for NYC building standards and more.

About Councilmatic 

Finally, an open government website for everything in the NYC Council. NYC Councilmatic (nyc.councilmatic.org) launched on September 30th, 2015, and in January 2016 is ramping-up a public discussion program with participating city council offices. Councilmatic is free, open-source, and generates unique open data in the Open Civic Data standard - Councilmatic.org is a project of the NYC-based non-profit Participatory Politics Foundation, which has a mission to increase civic engagement, with the civic tech company DataMade as tech leads. More info: http://participatorypolitics.org/

David Moore, Councilmatic
results.name: Civic Hacking With the NYC Council (yes, with)

results.description:
This month we've teamed up with Dev Bootcamp to host our biggest ever event on Tuesday, January 26th in their offices downtown. (Dev Bootcamp is generously providing drinks and refreshments!) 

Since this is a bigger group, and we'll still be limiting the show to 8 performances as always, please let us know as soon as possible if you're interested in being selected as one of the performers. We will be announcing the final list of musicians and comedians in mid January. 


Technical Talent is all about letting techies push the limits of their creative pursuits by giving a stage and an audience to anyone in tech that wants to share their talent and passion with the community.


Please RSVP here and be sure to provide your name for building security (those who don't RSVP will not be able to enter the building). We'll be limiting attendees to about 60 people, so sign up today and email me with any questions.

Also, click to share on Twitter or Facebook!

About our partner: Dev Bootcamp is the original, short-term, immersive software development program that transforms those new to coding into job-ready, full-stack web developers.
results.name: Tech Talent 1 Year Anniversary Show

results.description:
[The following was published here on Tuesday, 26 January 2016, at 11:45 AM.]


Dear Synergist!

Look forward to seeing you tonight (Tuesday, 26 January) at CityScience. (That’s at 6:30 to 8:30 PM, Suite #403, 68 Jay Street, DUMBO, Brooklyn.) Hey, we'll be showing the first Rev of our prototype Health Maker Lab (HML) "Floor Plan." This design/layout will spotlight what our current prototype Lab may "look like”...and DO.

We'll also review our new Donor pitch-deck. And, also take a look at our LabFan Partner/Donor "Get Started" program. I'm also going to encourage audience participants to exchange and brainstorm real-time on some of our important and evolving HML issues and opportunities.

(Please RSVP and kindly donate your nominal admission fee on this event page.)

We're accelerating; come for the exhilarating ride...!!

LAND

Founder, 3DP Media & 
Health Maker Lab

PS. IF you can’t make it out to our Meetup this evening in person, we’re going to Live Stream the event. So, link here to HML’s LiveStream (OR, insert this URL in your browser: http://livestream.com/openarmsstudio/events/4741009) between 6:30 & 6:45 PM this evening. (Of course, nothing beats being with us in person for an enriching experience…)


+++

[The following was published here on Monday, 25 January 2016, at 3:30 PM.] 


Dear Synergist!

Tomorrow evening---Tuesday, 26 January, at 6:30 PM---we roll out our red carpet and invite you in to plan, progress and “play” with us to continue advancing Health Maker Lab (HML). (CityScience is venue-hosting us at their offices at 68 Jay Street, Suite #403, DUMBO.)

Tomorrow night---AND in this email---we’ll also explain how you can become a LabFan. Your use of HML's LabFan Donor-Starter Promo Kit will benefit your own organization while benefiting HML.

HML’s LabFan is a compelling means for your organization to get to know---and be known by!---Health Maker Lab’s important and growing Community of Health players. Ours is a broad, nonprofit, Health-enhancing mission and we proffer a Big Tent “welcome” of Healthcare diversity.

HML’s unique marketplace-positioning presents LabFan-program participants with targeted and effective means to access our segments’ decision-makers. While, at the same time, enhancing the well-being of many NYC local and City-wide communities. Further---via LabFan---your organization will learn from, and collaborate with, us for mutual betterment going forward. 

Plus---as a Founding LabFan---you’ll have “first-refusal” opportunities for taking precedent-advantage of future HML promotions.

Our LabFan program is low-cost and low-risk---while delivering high rewards to your company or group. That includes superior ROI to buttress your "early supporter" status. We've created LabFan to advance your organization’s interest in accessing our present and prospective HML Community. All while creating goodwill for you and show-casing your positive profile.

So, come join-in with us tomorrow evening in person for our proven mix of Health Maker Lab news, ideas, discussion and exchange around our common interests. (RSVP on this page and kindly donate a nominal admission fee.) We’ll talk more about LabFan at Tuesday night’s event. But---if you’d like more right now---please read on below.

Land

Organizer, “HCx3DP Meetup NY” &
Founder, Health Maker Lab

+++

HML's LabFan Donor-Starter Promo Kit.

Please let me outline how LabFan would work---for both our organizations---via our latest introductory Outline here.

Become a "LabFan" Leader: Gain from Founding-LabFan participation in support of HML development via PR, promotion and positioning within our innovative Program:

(A.)  Get involved and inspired (see specifics below): garner business gains (hard and soft) from our HML community's social commerce and common-good advancement.

(B.)  Help grow our HML Community (for your benefit and ours): make attendance at our events free for HML participants via donations by your LabFan Leader organization.

(C.)  Build interest, base and clout for both our innovative HML Program AND your LabFan organization.

(D.)  Micro support delivers Macro fostering: Join us---early and cost-effectively---at $500 per month for three months of trial LabFan status. (Want even more compelling terms? Invest three months up front for $1,275---instead of $1,500 over three months.)

(E.)  After three months, decide whether a deeper relationship with HML is important to your organization's goals. Then---if we've build goodwill with you---consider moving up to an appropriate "Founding" Donor level.

+++

+++

As promised in Item (A.) above, here are our initial "specifics" of "HML LabFan Donor Features ->>> Benefits"---delivering benefit/ROIs of customer-goodwill and more---to early-adopter/trial Donor "LabFans": 

(1) HML LabFan-Community positive public positioning ->>> LabFan-participating Organizations will enjoy appropriate showcasing as a leader in the innovative HML Community; 

(2) Appropriate promotion on HML Web site or custom SocMed Community site ->>> regular "collaborator" spotlighting of LabFan support for HML Community interests;

(3) Supported LabFan Web-site page or Hosted Social Network/SocMed exposure ->>> LabFan-created appropriate/curated showcasing for HML Community promo purposes;

(4) LabFan created & delivered (HML-curated, hosted & intro'ed) presentations at HML events ->>> enables LabFan added-value "story-telling" for HML Community betterment;

(5) LabFan Member-created & manned Mini-Exhibit tabletop displays at HML events ->>> enables LabFan added-value product & service "Show & Tell" for HML Community delight;

(6) LG provides LabFan-appropriate media coverage ->>> depending on LabFan Organization news "production," LG will freelance articles to sector-selected media vehicles, at one per month;

(7) LG provides LabFan eIntros to appropriate players in the "Big Tent" HML marketplace ->>> LG knowledge of player interests promises relationship-development matchmaking;

(8) LabFan Org-sponsored (added cost to participants) & HML-led Tours of Meetups, Maker Spaces & Facilities of HML-Community Interest ->>> primary field-research & relationship building.

+++

Dear Synergist, I hope you have found our LabFan Program introduction above---"LabFan" Leader outline and LabFan Donor-Starter Promo Kit "Features & Benefits"---compelling. Especially for the very-low, early-adopter/Donor cost. Plus, the added opportunity to be involved---at our Health Maker Lab “kick-off”---in an innovative and promising program for better commercial and common-good Health futures for all our involved communities.

---LG

[End]

+++


[The following was published here on Saturday, 23 January 2016, at 11 AM.] 

…AND, Greetings---Synergist---from the Blizzard of 2016 here in Tech-Centric Brooklyn!

[I’m writing to you from my home office --- in our DUMBO loft apartment overlooking the Brooklyn Bridge and Downtown Manhattan. The weather conditions ARE fulfilling the meteorological definition of “blizzard.” Semi “white-out” visibility through the high-wind driven horizontally blowing snow. Our accumulation is forecast to be ~2 inches per hour for much of the rest of the day. I can hear the muffled scrapping of plow-blades on BQE and Bridge roadways below about every 7 or 8 minutes. Who knows what the total snow-fall will measure in our neighborhood… Still---like my local Grandsons---I’m eager to get out in it…at least for a time…!!]

Now, below is the Health Maker Lab (HML) update I promised you in our most-recent emailed HML news of 19 January.

Many of our new, official Advisory Council members will be participating at our Tuesday, 26 January, HCx3DP Meetup/Health Maker Lab Review & Workshop (#8).

Please come out and join-in with your enthusiasm and ideas at CitySci. We're planning to address---as a group---a number of issues and opportunities during this Meetup. (Please RSVP and donate on this Page.) We'd love you help!

LAND 
Organizer, "HCx3DP Meetup NY" & 
Founder, Health Maker Lab

+++


HML News: A Review at the End & Beginning of 2015/16 [you may have already gotten updates about some of these doings...] ---

To encourage your continued interest to join-in our accelerating success --- which will also be yours! --- here's our latest HML News:

(A) City Science Venue-Hosts HCx3DP/HML Again (confirming our connection to important players) ---

On Tuesday, 26 January, CitySci will host our next "HCx3DP Meetup NY"/Health Maker Lab Report & Workshop. We'll be back at City Science here in DUMBO---for the third time! CitySci---a STEM-Ed NfP using the City as an education venue---is also one of our top STEM-Partners. Their continued pro bono support bodes well for our strengthening relationship.

(B) Our First Major Corporate Donor ---

3DPrinterOS---creator of a Cloud-based, Open, 3DP Operating System---has pledged $30K worth of 3D printers.

(C) A New Director Accepts a Seat --- 

Aaron Roy, Director of Strategy & Operations at 3DPrinterOS, has now joined our Board. 

(D) Another Talented and Enthusiastic Volunteer ---

Gianna Curcio---Mechanical Engineer, Digirati, 3DP Technician for the VA/Manhattan & a Digital Artist---joins our Videographer, Marcin Kulesza, to help out.

(E) Meeting, on 11 January, with NYU-Tandon at MetroTech Center, Downtown BK ---

I met with the NYU-Tandon's (new name of the NYU {née Polytechnic} School of Engineering) Vice Dean for Research, Innovation and Entrepreneurship Kurt Becker---and an old friend---on Monday, 11 January. 

I had multiple goals for this meeting. And, a concluding slide-full of "asks!" But, my first objective was to interest NYU-Tandon in hosting our physical HML prototype space. In exchange for a novel, turnkey Lab replete with major players, mentors, trainers, lecturers and eTinkers---with strategic Healthcare disciplines, innovations, equipment and an accelerator---open to his Tandon community.

I think that a Higher Ed Institution (HEI) is a natural venue-partner for our HML prototype. If NYU-Tandon passes on this opportunity, we have---literally!---10 other HEIs in Downtown Brooklyn. Next in line would probably be CUNY NY Tech followed by LIU... (The Downtown BK Partnership has already created a working consortium of these 11 HEIs and their 60K (!!) students---another resource we WILL tap!)

In the meantime, Kurt and I are continuing our discussions around the specific common-interests we identified on 11 January. And, our HML "Asks!"

(F) This last week, I had another principal-to-principal Partner/Donor Meeting with a 3DP player AND a very rich experience with Genspace---one of their public "Entrepreneur Talks" and exchanges thereafter about mutual interests (I love this pioneering and innovative LifeSci organization!) ---

As these fertile matters develop, I'll be back to fill you in.

---LG

[End]

+++


[The following was published here on 19 January 2016.] 

Fellow Synergist! Hope & Trust your end-of-year Celebratory Season was as grand as you could have wished...

Now, it's time to "meetup" again in 2016. LOTS going on! MUCH to talk about! PLENTY (as ever!) to learn from you! Our first event of the year---HCx3DP Meetup NY with Health Maker Lab Update & Workshop---is STILL scheduled for Tuesday, 26 January, from 6:30 to 8:30 PM here in DUMBO.

HOWEVER, WE HAVE CHANGED THE VENUE!!!

CityScience---another one of our regular Venue Hosts---is now welcoming us all back to their offices in DUMBO (for the third time). CitySci's address is 68 Jay Street, Suite 403. Our event is at the SAME date and time as announced prior---and shown above in this post and on this Event Page.

Looking forward to working with You in this New Year. Come next week to help us power our HML "rocket ride" as we accelerate our progress in 2016. Come be part of something important...for You, for all our Synergists and for members of the other communities we plan to enhance! 

How? By empowering Citizen-Scientists---like You---to create healthier lifestyles, novel healthcare solutions and better patient outcomes at the local MakerRoots. (Say...THIS is part of Health Maker Lab's Mission Statement...!)


LAND

+++


[The following was published here 3 December 2015.] 

Okay, Would-Be Synergist! Yep, I'm addressing those of you---among our 200 members---who have yet to get personally involved since you "signed up" here with "HCx3DP Meetup NY." 

This is still our official name...even though we've invested the last seven or eight months in a key, innovative subset of "HCx3DP..." That is "Health Maker Lab"---HML, for short.

Bear with me! In this update, I'm going to present additional (compelling!!) reasons for you to commit more of your time and attention to HML. I think in many cases, your free-will commitment likely comes down---in the main---to the appeal of our evolving strategies. And, how---despite this world full of so much choice---they complement your own interests .

Fair enough. Since some of you joined our Meetup Community, we HAVE changed our targets and readjusted our focus. Health Maker Lab is BOTH broader and narrower than HCx3DP. 

Broader in that we've expanded "3DP" to Digital Fabrication---or, DigiFab. You know as well as I that tech of every kind is evolving at lightning speed. 3D Printing is an important subset of DigiFab---especially when applied to Healthcare solutions. BUT, there are effective ways and means beyond 3DP to deliver those novel and necessary answers. Especially if we're thinking "Big Tent."

Narrower in that we've drilling down to determine the most effective of our ultimate HML solutions. Those solutions that will best meet the needs of specific patient, client or recipient communities for improved health---in a larger compass of that phrase. From our HML Community to the larger local community by narrowing our "envisioning" to integrate appropriate solutions. Even if they are NOT the traditional modes of "modern" medicine.

Big Tent---

Now---as this post's title suggests---our HML operational strategy includes putting up a Big Tent and inviting disparate interests (yours!) to enter in expectation and join in our convocation successfully. At this point, we will be hard put to keep our internal HML Action Centers to eight or 10. And, to address the needs of "only" five or six external neighborhood partner or player populations. 

Internally, diverse Action Centers will promote the cross-pollination of new and novel ideas. Leading to what we hope are effective hybrid solutions in Healthcare. 

Externally, serving the varied needs of sometimes competing neighborhood interest groups and organizations ("Hood Hubs!") WILL add to the complexity of our interfaces, relationships and connections. Human interactions ARE usually "messy." (As Miss Frizzle of "The Magic School Bus" admonishes those who would produce scientific creativity: "Take chances; make mistakes; get messy.") We will have to inform our out-facing perspectives with common-good POVs commonly shared.

GeoPrint---

Our HML "action footprint" on the maps of our overlapping communities---our GeoPrint---are likely to be rather fluid. Especially to start. The interests of our HML Community, donors and partners and Healthcare recipients will ensure some curious GeoPrint "gerrymandering." At least until we can rationalize our efforts---from (eventually) adequate resources.

Our startup GeoPrint will (likely!) center in Brooklyn---the "Techreative" Borough. Our initial home-base will (likely!) reside in the Brooklyn Tech Triangle (BTT). That's DUMBO (the City's official "Digital District"), the Brooklyn Navy Yard (335 tech-driven startups and ramp-ups) and Downtown Brooklyn (14 higher ed institutions and 60K students). A rich stew of assets that will help us to launch successfully. (I've lived and worked in Brooklyn for over 35 years and I can vouch for its base of resources---in our pursuit of a new kind of Health.) 

From the BTT, we'll (likely!) spread in Brownstone and Riparian (East River) BK and east into UltraUrban East New York and Brownsville. Neighborhoods of high health needs. NYC enjoys 55 major Healthcare facilities. The self-selected among these will act as our first Hood Hubs among equals. We are---after all---focused on Health and hospitals strive to deliver that uncommon commodity.

Donors and partners---action resources---may drive the expansion of our GeoPrint in unpredictable directions. It is possible that interested players in northern New Jersey could influence our development there---before, say, The Bronx or Staten Island. Certainly, the TriState Region is a natural GeoPrint extension for HML. After that...the world?!!

Viral Ecosystem---

Health Maker Lab is intent on prototyping its inspirations, ideas and innovations in an initial "sandbox" location. We'll play with the combinations that fascinate and foster the most promising solutions to diverse needs. The most  certain possibilities are the certainty of the unexpected. 

As an antidote to negative results, we will call on our Advisory Council (eventually 15 in number) of proven players. These advisors---the bases for our Action Centers---will keep us progressing appropriately to a stable ecosystem at our first HML location.

At that breakout point, we envision a kind of viral HML "reproduction" regimen will commence. Successful ways and means, models and modes and---most importantly---trained and experienced cadre will empower rapid growth (likely?) within New York City.

+++

These expectations will indeed require good people to achieve. Thus, we need YOU to become an active Synergist for Health Maker Lab success. Get excited; get psyched; get into action!

+++

Please join-in our 15 December Meetup (RSVP and contribute here). Learn more about our Health Maker Lab strategic overview in person. Come find your personal reason(s) to become an active member of our Community. Move us ahead...

Best!

LAND, Organizer       
HCx3DP Meetup NY   
& Founder, Health Maker Lab

+++


[The following was published here 2 December 2015.] 

HUZZAH!

Health Maker Lab is now a New York State Nonprofit corporation. Yowza!!!

+++

In transitioning into a Not-for-Profit (NfP), we'll be picking up our development tempo...and, therefore, our need for "in-kind," hands-on, volunteer support. 

Want to join-in the innovation on our HealthMaker "groundfloor?!" Got WordPress chops? (We're building a new HML Web site.) QuickBooks skills? (We need bookkeeping.) Media cred? (We're hot to tell the world---and all those potential donors out there---of the Healthcare solutions our Citizen Scientists will be creating...) 

During our early going here, we're likely to need many different skill sets. If you're intent on helping, we're intent on having your good assistance. Reach out and tell us what you can---and/or want to---do...

+++

Today, we received email notification of our new "NfP" status. (According to Albany, our "Exist Date" is 19 November 2015. But, it took the Department of State nearly two more weeks to let us know...hey, we're grateful it was that quick!)

I'd like to publicly thank our Brooklyn Law School (BLS) Legal-Intern Team---ably led by Dominika Wilk---for their professional, pro bono work on HML's behalf in this NfP incorporation effort. These graduate law students work for the Community Development Clinic of BLS' CUBE (Center for Urban Business Entrepreneurship) under the Directorship of Professor David Reiss.

Our next steps in this NfP process include infrastructure-building efforts---like By-Law customization and constitution of a Board of Directors and our "Advisory Council." This latter will be an official structuring of our current informal advisory team. 

Further steps will include pursuit of our status as a 501(c)(3) Nonprofit via an application to the IRS. (This is the coveted class that enables donors to HML to take tax advantage of their donations.) Where NYState process took weeks, the IRS is likely to take months. 

Fortunately, my Congresswoman Nydia Velazquez is the Ranking Democratic Member of the Small Business Committee of the House of Representatives. I've recently participated in a roundtable on Federal "grantsmanship" organized by Ms. Velazquez. So, her local staff has already promised proactive "constituent services" in expediting our IRS NfP petition. 

In the meantime, HML will nonetheless be able to legally accept NfP donations. Future IRS validation will enable retroactive donation-deductions by our givers.

Please come out to our 15 December Meetup (RSVP and contribute here). Come learn more---about what and when and where and how we're doing---in person. Come get excited!!

Best!

LAND, Organizer      
HCx3DP Meetup NY  
& Founder, Health Maker Lab

+++


[The following was published here 1 December 2015.]


Dear Synergist!

In the run-up to our 15 December Meetup, I will continue to showcase our Health Maker Lab (HML) evolutions for your understanding and benefit. 

To that end, here is our latest HML Mission Statement, Revision #4. (Certainly, with more Revs to come.) Let us have your input, please!

We submitted our Nonprofit application to New York State at the start of November. We expect to receive the State's approval this month.

+++

Mission Statement (Revision #4):

Short Form

Health Maker Lab empowers New York City Citizen-Scientists to create healthier lifestyles, novel Healthcare solutions and better patient outcomes at their community MakerRoots---via effective, open-source tech and co-located, commingled and complementary bio/med/tech disciplines in co-tenanted LifeSciences focused, outfitted and supported Maker Spaces.

Long Form

Health Maker Lab (HML) empowers New York City Citizen-Scientists to create healthier lifestyles, novel Healthcare solutions and better patient outcomes at their community MakerRoots---via effective, open-source tech and co-located, commingled and complementary bio/med/tech disciplines in a co-tenanted LifeSciences focused, outfitted and supported Maker Spaces.

We will take a "Big Tent" approach to nurturing creativity by cross-breeding new development-models across and among Health-focused sectors. This includes the integration of HML-based Action Centers---a community of affiliations that support multi-discipline, multi-tenant, multi-service-provisioned Life Makers to interact successfully.

To begin fostering superior healthy life-styles and patient out-comes, we will establish our prototype HML in "Techreative" Brooklyn. To assure success and sustainability at our ultra-urban, neighborhood level, we will employ appropriate, open-source technology and new modes of Life Making. These latter include Health Making, Bio/Med Tech, LifeScience Entrepreneurship and Healthcare-Job Generation.

Our HML solution drivers will include:

(1) the Maker Movement ethos (DIY, DIT & DID {Do It at a Distance});

(2) positive, technology-driven disrupting and democratizing ("DisDem") today's and tomorrow's Healthcare;

(3) regular community convocations ("ComCon") of interests via physical affiliation and online connection; and

(4) new modes of tech education and enablement (e.g., hyper-search, tactile or project-based learning, just-in-time education and bespoke bootcamps).

HML seeks to assure effective integration with---and service to---its home neighborhood. To that end, we will closely collaborate with key community players and institutions---while remaining independent: physically, operationally and psychologically. These local, HML "anchor/partners" will include:

(A) healthcare facilities,

(B) economic development organizations,

(C) educational institutions,

(D) local government offices and

(E) faith-based congregations.

Going forward, Health Maker Lab will strive to build a network of interconnected Labs throughout the Five Boroughs---on the way to extending our Health Maker Lab community-system to the Tri-State Region.

Copyright Land Grant 2015.

+++

As we add new updates to our Event Page description, we will leave previous "posts"---for your review---serially in place below each new entry.

Best!

LAND, Organizer     
HCx3DP Meetup NY 
& Founder, Health Maker Lab

+++


[The following was published here 30 November 2015.]

Dear Synergist!

[I hope and trust your Thanksgiving was grand…however you may have celebrated it. For us---here in DUMBO---it was multi-generations, multi-nations and multi-cuisines. Turkey, yes…but roulades stuffed with mofongo and bacon and topped with spicy sour-cream/cilantro “gravy”---Yowza!]

Good for Einstein. He proclaimed that “Imagination is more important than knowledge.” With a Ph.D., what you “Pile higher & Deeper” is knowledge, NOT imagination. 

(Sadly for many of those with such hard-won credentials, knowledge is now a drug on the market. Today, exponentially accelerating tech change---think the disrupting and democratizing of the Internet, Big Data, Cloud Systems, HyperSearch, JIT Edu, etc., etc.---discounts knowledge of every kind. Just ask the very over-worked and woefully underpaid Adjunct Professor---a Ph.D., of course---at your local Higher Education Institution…) 

Imagination is the fuel of creativity. Creativity is the driver to wherever you may wish to go. AND, your creative engine will enable you to take others along for the ride of their lives---be they colleagues, clients or an entire class of your fellow humans. 

• With Health Maker Lab (HML), we’re building a vehicle you can rocket to the stars---or, at least, your star of choice in the Constellation of HealthMaking---from our “Spaceport NYC.” 

The more we work at planning and implementing our Nonprofit-in-the-making HML, the more empowering is the “Big Tent” inclusiveness concept we are using to define our HealthMaking. 

Got leading-edge/bleeding-edge ideas? (From foods as meds to lifestyle “prescriptives” to high-style prosthetics to novel uses of new materials to neuro-techs to mortal-moment memoranda to…) Plan to build your starship in our sandbox. And, make sure we get it right…because you helped to make it right.

Our Tuesday, 15 December Meetup in DUMBO is Iteration 7 in our informal series of Health Maker Lab Workshops.

Please be here with us…

+++

AND, we're delighted that DUMBO Startup Lab is Venue-Hosting us---for the second time!---at their offices (68 Jay St., Suite 718) in DUMBO, Brooklyn. 

+++

Best!

LAND, Organizer    
HCx3DP Meetup NY
& Founder, Health Maker Lab


PS. In the next days, I'll be back here to present you with our latest iteration (Rev 3.0) of HML's Mission Statement.

PPS. As usual, at our 15 December event, we'll also be welcoming back members of our expanding HML "informal advisory team" to help us plan and advance our innovative initiative.


So, come join-in with topic leaders in health tech, HCx3DP, DigiFab, DIY bio, neuro-tech, STEAM education, HC 'preneurship, supporting professions and more---RSVP and support our Meetup via payment here and come participate!

Informal Advisory Board Members:

David Solomonoff, President, New York Chapter, Internet Society; 

Jon Luongo, MS, CCLS, Child Life Specialist, Maimonides Infants & Children's Hospital;

Matt Lipschutz, Meetup Co-Organizer, Hack Manhattan;

Victor Ty, Pediatric Radiation Oncology RN at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center; Health Maker in LEGO Medical & LEGO 3D Medical Designs;   

Oliver Medvedik, PhD., Co-Founder; Director, Scientific Programs, Genspace;

Jonathan Askin, Technology Law Professor, Founder/Director, Brooklyn Law Incubator & Policy (BLIP) Clinic, Brooklyn Law School. Innovation Catalyst for the Brooklyn Law Center (CUBE) for Urban Business Entrepreneurship;

Andrew O'Shaughnessy, Project Manager, Health Tech, Center for Economic Transformation, New York City Economic Development Corporation;

Aaron Roy, Head of Operations & Strategy, 3DPrinterOS, innovators in 3DP education & enterprise via the most powerful, open source, 3D Printing management platform in the world;

Conor Russomanno, Co-F & CEO of OpenBCI & Organizer of the new NeuroTechNYC Meetup;

Thor Snilsberg, Executive Director, CityScience: committed to raising the quality of science education and supporting environmental stewardship using the natural and built environments as laboratories for active learning;

Guido Gabriele, Esq., Grassi & Co. Litigation Supervisor: accountancy with multi-offices in NY State and practices in Healthcare and Technology;

Danny Cabrera, Co-Founder & CEO, BioBots: desktop 3D BioPrinters that build 3D living tissues from human cells that constitute "bio-inks." 

[End]

Meet us on the last Tuesday of the Month to learn, discuss and practice Business Model Generation (BMG), the Canvas, a little bit of Lean Startup and overall business common sense.

This methodology is a simple way to get a high level view of your current or future business and understand how each part of it integrates and interacts with the others. We use the Canvas, a simple diagram, to map these parts and interactions.

While fairly simple, this methodology is a very powerful tool.

You can learn more about the book, methodology, author, and the Canvas :

See you all then !

Dan & Stephen.

results.description:
We are kicking off 2016 with a phenomenal presentation on creativity led by Daniel Cherry III, the Chief Marketing and Innovation Officer of the NJ Devils and Prudential Center. You won't want to miss this! 

Speaker Bio:

As Chief Marketing & Innovation Officer of the three-time Stanley Cup Champion New Jersey Devils (NHL) and Prudential Center, the state-of-the-art multi-purpose arena located in Newark, N.J., Daniel Cherry III leads the strategy and implementation of the sports and entertainment organization’s marketing, communications and community initiatives. Daniel joined the Devils and Prudential Center in August 2015 with more than 15 years of sports, entertainment and consumer marketing experience working for some of top companies and brands in the industry.

Daniel served as Senior Vice President of Marketing at DIAGEO, where he was responsible for leading the marketing and brand strategy across several spirits categories, totaling over 27 million cases sold and generating over $2.2 billion in annual revenue. His time at Diageo was highlighted by the launch of Ciroc Pineapple, one of the most successful and fastest growing spirit innovations of all-time, with over 1 million cases sold within the product’s first calendar year. He was also behind the successful launch of Smirnoff’s first trademark campaign in over a decade, the launch of Captain Morgan White and Flavors, and the re-launch of Tanqueray’s No. Ten luxury brand, leading to a 30 percent increase in year-over-year growth.

Prior to his work with DIAGEO, Daniel was the Chief Marketing Officer of the New York Cosmos franchise, where he developed the re-launch strategy, commercial and retail business model, and marketing communications plan for the rebirth of the iconic soccer club in 2010. While with the Cosmos, he secured global apparel licensing deals with Umbro and New Era and executed award-winning, global advertising campaigns with soccer legends Pelé, Cobi Jones, Carlos Alberto Torres and Eric Cantona. Daniel also helped establish a $30 million valuation and buyout of the re-launched Cosmos International Soccer Brand.

Daniel also has extensive agency experience and has worked with some of the most innovative companies in the business. He served as Managing Partner & Director of Brand Strategy at Anomaly, regularly named one of Fast Company’s most innovative agencies, working with global brands such as Converse, Umbro, Cole Haan, Budweiser and Motorola to gross annual billings of over $35 million. As a brand strategist at Wieden+Kennedy, Daniel led Nike, the Jordan Brand and ESPN accounts. His work on Nike included the 2007 Grammy-nominated song “Classic” (Better Than I’ve Ever Been) featuring pop stars Kanye West, Nas, Rakim and KRS-One. His passion and expertise in music marketing led to his 2010 selection to the board of the Grammy Foundation.

Before W+K, Daniel was a co-owner of Frank151 Magazine and malbon Brothers Farms (mBF), the advertising and brand consulting division of Frank151 Media Group, where he led branded content, influencer and experiential marketing strategies for a number of iconic lifestyle brands, including Red Bull, Toyota Scion, Nike, glaceáu Vitaminwater, PF Flyers and Ride Snowboards.

Daniel got his start in advertising at Crispin Porter + Bogusky where he successfully helped bring AND 1 Basketball to the forefront of the athletic apparel industry. The breadth of work for the AND 1 brand, which included the groundbreaking "AND 1 Mixtape Series” (a street basketball tour and content platform) landed AND 1 Adweek’s "Guerilla Marketer of the Year" in 2000. He also played a critical role in the development of the anti-tobacco “truth.com” brand, a campaign that has grown to be the most successful teen anti-smoking effort in history. Daniel is a proud father, husband, and graduate of the University of Pennsylvania.

Agenda: Event held in Bove Auditorium. 

6:30-7:00 Arrival, networking, and pizza
7:00-8:00 Presentation
8:00-8:30 Networking

results.description:
Meet us on the last Tuesday of the Month to learn, discuss and practice Business Model Generation (BMG), the Canvas, a little bit of Lean Startup and overall business common sense.

This methodology is a simple way to get a high level view of your current or future business and understand how each part of it integrates and interacts with the others. We use the Canvas, a simple diagram, to map these parts and interactions.

While fairly simple, this methodology is a very powerful tool.

You can learn more about the book, methodology, author, and the Canvas :

>> here << 

See you all then !

Dan & Stephen.

results.description:
Hope you had a great holiday! Now that you're all rested up and the New Year is here, I thought I would kick things off with a good ol' fashioned networking event!

I'm inviting innovators like yourself to come together afterwork for an evening of networking at Village Pourhouse!

Let's get together and share holiday stories and our plans to conquer the world this year!

As usual, the purpose of this evening will be to help anyone who is interested in developing new business & social connections.

You will be one of the many other entrepreneurs/creatives who will be in attendance! Hopefully this mixer will help you to jumpstart 2016!

I think that you'll have fun, you'll develop friendships and hopefully some valuable business connections as well. I know that you'll leave the event more motivated than when you walked in and in a mindset that will help you to begin achieving the high goals you set for this New Year!

And because I know how important that first cup of coffee is to most entrepreneurs, first 100 registrants online will be entered to win a $25 Starbucks Gift Card.

I may have a couple of other surprises to giveaway, so be sure to drop your business card at the door for the business card draw!

==

Plus get a special preview of my friend Janie Ho, former reporter at BusinessWeek, writer at GQ and New York Magazine, and former global strategic analyst at LinkedIn ... who will be announcing her new Leveraging LinkedIn, Social Media and Marketing class, which takes place Monday, February 22nd at The Farm Soho. 

Tickets + Promos: bit.ly/janieevent
FB event page: bit.ly/janiespeak

results.description:
AfriStack is excited to host a free basic class in Python for non-programmers, in partnership with the Bronx Museum of the Arts to make the knowledge of this programming language accessible to all. This serves as an introductory class for more advanced programming concepts.

According to python.org, "Python is powerful... and fast; plays well with others; runs everywhere; is friendly & easy to learn; is Open."

In this class you can expect to learn:

1. Your First Python Program 

2. Data Types and Functions

3. Object-Oriented Programming

4. Python Use in the Real World

There is NO programming experience needed for this course & this event is open to all ages. If you can bring your middle or high school child/student with you, please do!

It is essential that you bring a laptop as a lot of the learning is done through participation.

Please note that pictures and/or video of the class will be taken for our records

Please RSVP here on Eventbrite: http://afristack-python-intro.eventbrite.com/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/afristack

Twitter: https://twitter.com/afristack

Contact email and phone number: [masked] /[masked]

Pre-Workshop Preparation:

Recommended: Install Python on your laptop:

Visit https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-2710/ for instructions on how to download and install Python for your Windows or Mac laptop.

Presenter Biograpghy: 

Muhammad Jalloh is a software developer with a special focus on using Python and Javascript to create social networks, interactive maps and online collaborative communities.

Wow! It's been a whole year since we've done our last meetup! We've been really hard at work on our internal microservices architecture, and we're finally ready to share our last year of experiences with you all. Look at this as an exciting opportunity to network, have some pizza and beer, and hear our story while having yours heard as well.

Topics Touched

• Docker


• Rancher

• Jenkins

• RabbitMQ


• Cloud Providers

• A touch of Golang


• Distributed Systems


I'll prepare a brief history of what we've learned between strengths and weaknesses with each of the technologies above, and invite you to have an in depth discussion with choices we've made which will hopefully reinforce your decisions or cause us to challenge our own! Microservices are all the rave right now, let's try to figure out exactly what they mean through what we've learned so far!

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your NEW YEAR with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.

results.description:
Evan is Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Meetup.com, where he works on recommendations and other large-scale data problems. 

When Recommendation Systems Go Bad 

Machine learning and recommendations systems have changed the way we interact with not just the internet, but some of the basic products and services that we use to organize and run our life. As the people that build these systems, we have a social responsibility to consider how these systems affect people, and furthermore, we should do whatever we can to prevent these systems and models from perpetuating some of the prejudice and bias that exist in our society today. 

In this talk I intend to cover some of the recommendation systems that have gone wrong across various industries, and attempt to provide some solutions for prevention. First and foremost among these is awareness, but approaches involving interpretable models, using ensemble models to separate features that shouldn't interact, and designing test data sets for capturing bias will also be explored.
results.name: When Recommendation Systems Go Bad

results.description:
Join AMC's New York-North Jersey Chapter Ski Committee for the first expedition social event of 2016. We're getting together at Reunion Surf Bar in Hell's Kitchen for some drinks, snacks, and to discuss what it's like to get out and ski with the AMC! Whether you cross country, downhill, or backcountry the AMC has something for you.
Expert members and staff will be there to discuss everything you need to know Skiing with the AMC and help you get outdoors. Never been on skis before? No problem, the AMC leads all types of activities from beginner to expert.
__________

Each month the AMC Expedition Social team will select an interesting location to meet up with members from one of our activity committees. Then we'll invite everyone any anyone to join us in a discussion that highlights topics like Hiking, Climbing, Biking, Skiing, or Backpacking. We'll discuss what interests us in that activity, how to get started, and why it's great to get out and do it with the AMC. Our mission is to provide you with the knowledge, tools, and confidence you need to get outdoors!
results.name: Expedition Social - Ski

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:
There are many things to consider when starting a new business that are often misunderstood or not considered. 

Taking advantage of the expertise of our hosts at McCarter & English, we're covering what you need to know to help you make sure you're set up and properly structured for any eventuality.

Major topics will include:

-Raising Capital

-What time of entity to incorporate as and why

-Employment Strategy 

-Intellectual Property 

As always, this is an open discussion. We encourage you to ask questions and voice any challenges you might be facing.  There will be ample opportunity to speak with the McCarter & English team before, after, and during the presentation.

Don't worry, we'll also have food and drinks and time for good old fashioned schmoozing.  

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Startup Bootcamp! Get Your Company Started in 2016

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.


If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.
results.how_to_find_us: We’re on the second floor of the building in the far end
results.name: Tech Tuesday Open House at Hack Manhattan

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
results.how_to_find_us: soccer, indoor soccer, futsal, new york futsal, futsal across america, futbol, futbolito, fifa

results.description:
Paul Ross will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.name: English Country Dance with Paul Ross!

results.description:
It's a new year, time to set yourself apart from the crowd and show employers why they should hire or promote you. Build and highlight your entrepreneurial skills to show how you add value. Entrepreneurs take risks, build teams, see potential all around them, and create opportunity. Recent research in psychology and neuroscience shows us that many of these assets are skills you can learn. 


In this workshop, we'll explore such best-selling books as Mindset, Made to Stick, To Sell is Human, Steve Jobs and more, to explore how you can build entrepreneurial skills and use these to advance in your career.

Our guest speaker will be: Francine Fabricant, MA, EdM

She is an experienced career development counselor, Hofstra Continuing Education instructor and co-author of the college text book, “Creating Career Success.”

Co-sponsored by the Port Washington Public Library Jobs & Careers Information Center

Limited enrollment of 35 members!
results.name: Think Like An Entrepreneur To Advance Your Career

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
We will meet and practice Zhineng(wisdom) Qigong level 1 exercises.

Cost nominal $5 to cover room rental

LQUPQD (Lift Qi UP/Pour Qi Down) and 3CM (Three Centers Merge). The first one is a dynamic moving exercise, the second 3CM is a stationary one.

These exercises remove blockages in our energetic system and increase Qi.

The benefits are: Stronger Health, Stable Emotions and Extraordinary Capability

About 15-18 people show up every meeting. We have been meeting for about four(4) months. We also have guest speaker nights. Where we invite high level masters from around the world. China/Malaysia/California

Edgar Cayce Center has a comfortable waiting area, w/ free coffee, tea, water. Please arrive 10-15 mintues before the event, meet our practice leader Ethan and other members

All the best

results.description:
Would you like to be supper-happy this year? Stop making excuses. Will you lose another year chasing the unicorn of happiness as a place you arrive? I could have told you happiness is a place, but the truth is very different. You may never arrive at a place called happiness. Why? Happiness is a process of life; a special method for living. Discover a method for happiness you can have now.


How to get started? Welcome to the "Happy Brain Studio":
Warning this is NOT another meditation for happiness class! Almost every book, video and website promises happiness if you meditate. This is completely different.

HAPPY- A Life process that allows actions and non-action to become         purposeful and satisfying.    Your everyday life makes sense,feels right and looks right to your brain and other people around you. 

BRAIN- the organ of memory, perception, sensing, awareness, and       consciousness. You and your entire life is based on the functions of your brain. 

STUDIO- an open space outfitted with materials and tools used to design                    and create.              

 "Happy Brain Studio"- A space where you learn how to custom design your brain and environments for purposeful and satisfying lifestyles. Design what you want to do and where you can produce the biggest achievements. Have       your happiness today instead of 10 years later.

The "HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO"- is a method based on cognitive neuroscience, behavioral economics, social science and most importantly human lifestyle reverse engineering ( deep scanning the lifestyles of happy people). Happiness is a unique person-to-person experience within the BRAIN-mind system. The studio supports you in finding your happiness blueprint through interactive experience and presentations.

Session 1 of the "HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO" opens with:

Maybe you have BELIEFS between you and happiness. Learn How to start working with the BELIEF SYSTEMS of happiness.


How to escape the hidden trap everyone exposed to self help psychology falls inside. If you fixed your life and solved all of your problems suddenly you would become happy. There is a superior more advance methods used by all successful people.

Understand the barriers between you and the happiness process.

Repeat, happiness is a life process. The number of hours in a day are fixed but you can spend more of them happy. RSVP for the "HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO" right now,before you start making excuses again. What if you miss the answer to your happiness because of excuses or your beliefs?
RSVP for the "HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO" right now. :)


Location: Ripley-Grier 
520 8th Avenue 17 FL 
Between 36th and 37th street 
New York, NY 10018 
Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.
Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 17 Floor
Walk though the glass doors and turn left and at the end 
turn right then left to the end of the hall
NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.
Room: 17 M

Online $10.00

Door $15.00


MATERIALS fee included! We use materials because we are always doing active processes based on brain and cognitive dynamics. WE USE STUFF TO MAKE SURE YOU GET RESULTS.
Each group session Rule: "What You Learn Today You Can Use Today"New members at some point start scrabbling to find pen and paper because they show up with an expectation the session is a sale pitch for something else. When "First timers"discover there is a NEW system of knowledge based on new tools, processes and understanding they start asking "do you have a pen and paper I can borrow?" Each session you always learn something you can use walking out the door.

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.
results.name: HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO SESSION 1 BELIEFS

results.description:
Pictorial Photographers of America (PPA) is open to photographers - professional, amateur, and beginner - of all levels. Founded by Clarence H. White in 1916, it is one of NYC's oldest photography clubs. One meeting per month is usually a presentation by a photo professional, and one is a members' competition (digital and print categories) critiqued and judged by a professional.

We meet at 7:00OPM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of the month at 346 West 20th Street (between 8th& 9th), St. Peter’s Church Rectory in Chelsea.

The next meeting with be on the Tuesday, January 26th will be a presentation.

Please ring the bell on the church rectory door when you arrive. You can contact us at: [masked]. Please email us if you are attending.

The presenter for this meeting will be John Milisenda. John’s photograhy has appeared in over 150 shows and many publications including Smithsonian and the New York Times. His work is in the permanent collections on Brooklyn Museum, New Orleans Museum of Art, Museum of Modern Art and Bibliotheque Nationale. He has taught basic photography ,The Zone System and Photographic chemistry at Drexel University, The New School, and Parson’s School of Design. He is currently working on a photography book of his family, a cross section of 50 years of work.

We are offering a special membership of $25.00 for the remainder of the season. You must attend the meeting on January 26th to take advantage of this membership offer

Visitors are very welcome.

Pictorial Photographers of America are celebrating their 100th anniversary this year in 2016 and we are finalizing plans for and exhibition.

We look forward to seeing you at the meeting
results.name: Next meeting will be a presentation by John Milisenda

Hi Everyone,

Our next Meetup will take place at:

The Mirage Diner on Tuesday, January 26, 2016 @ 7 PM.

717 Kings Highway, on the corner of E. 8th Street

Take the F train to Kings Highway and McDonald Avenue, where you can connect to the B82 bus towards Pennsylvania Ave., or the B or Q trains to Kings Highway and E. 16th Street, where you can connect to the B82 bus towards Cropsey Ave. For those who are driving, a parking lot is available at the diner.

The only requirement is that you order a minimum of $6.00 worth of food and/or drink during our Meetup.

Thank you for joining the group. Make it a great night playing Scrabble! Enjoy!

All the best,

Michele

results.description:
Professionals in healthcare across all functions and roles in the industry come together to network. This is the place to get new business contacts, find a new job, identify new customers and vendors, announce your start up, volunteer for a not-for-profit patient organization, meet industry connections, and make new friends. 

At this event, in addition to our usual networking, we are going to put focus on making a difference, doing for others and putting our strength in numbers to work. Do good, feel good. 

We will have representatives from various not-for-profits presenting and sharing information on their organizations and offering opportunities to get involved. 

Healthcare professionals can make a difference!! 

Invite your co-workers to attend. This is event is FREE to attend but you must sign up.  

If you are involved with a not-for-profit organization and want to do a 5 minute pitch at this event please fill out the application on www.healthcarepn.com. 

This event is hosted by the not-for-profit AHF PHARMACY (www.ahfpharmacy.org) and sponsored by LUPUS FRIENDS AND FAMILY FOUNDATION  (www.LupusFriendsAndFamily.org)
results.name: Healthcare Professionals making a difference

results.description:
For those who attend meet ups a lot, we will be charging a $50 Monthly fee and you can attend all the meet ups you like, we will Definitely have every Tuesday & Thursdays 7-8:30PM & Fridays 8-930 PM Weekend slots will Vary & Monday, & Wednesdays  will be added once we get more members attending. NO CONTRACT NO REGISTRATION pay the months you attend! unlimited soccer $50 (First 20 people to sign up only)

Want to play soccer, burn some energy? Release some stress? Play the sport you LOVE? Then come join us at SOCCER R US Indoor soccer facility, catering services to all you soccer players! COED PICK UP SOCCER. Come experience an awesome YEAR ROUND Indoor soccer facility in Brooklyn NEW YORK. Prospect Park train station on the Q OR B Train or S shuttle. Buses close by are the B41, 43, 16, 48 &  49


Indoor Soccer Facility with Real Turf Right by Prospect Park (Elevator available for bike riders)

FUTSAL In the Morning Before Work, During Lunch and Late Evenings

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time Vary So stay Tuned and look out for the time slots that suit you best

Real Turf, Please wear flats. 2 flights upstairs from entrance door or take elevator to 3rd floor

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING 

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.
results.how_to_find_us: Text or call 7187348469
results.name: Play Indoor soccer (Real Turf)

results.description:
[Jan 26] A presentation and a performance by Nao Nishihara exploring his kinetic sound machines, traditional Japanese folk music and includes the rare videos of folk musicians, monks and street performers.


Nao was born in Hiroshima in 1976. In 1998, he left Tokyo University of Foreign Studies (Czech Language) before graduating. In 2009, he graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts, with a degree in Musical Creativity and the Environment. In 2011, he obtained a master’s degree in Intermedia Art from Tokyo University of the Arts.
