results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place:

Small Italian eatery serving chef Mario Batali's Roman fare alongside an all-Italian wine list.


http://luparestaurant.com/

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.


Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Lupa - Italian

results.description:
How to get started? Welcome to the "Happy Brain Studio":
Warning this is NOT another meditation for happiness class! Almost every book, video and website promises happiness if you meditate. This is completely different.

HAPPY- A Life process that allows actions and non-action to become         purposeful and satisfying.    Your everyday life makes sense,feels right and looks right to your brain and other     people around you. 

BRAIN- the organ of memory, perception, sensing, awareness, and       consciousness. You and your entire life is based on the functions of your brain. 

STUDIO- an open space outfitted with materials and tools used to design                    and create.              

 "Happy Brain Studio"- A space where you learn how to custom design your brain and environments for purposeful and satisfying lifestyles. Design what you want to do and where you can produce the biggest achievements. Have       your happiness today instead of 10 years later.

The "HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO"- is a method based on cognitive neuroscience, behavioral economics, social science and most importantly human lifestyle reverse engineering ( deep scanning the lifestyles of happy people). Happiness is a unique person-to-person experience within the BRAIN-mind system. The studio supports you in finding your happiness blueprint through interactive experience and presentations.

Session 1 of the "HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO" opens with:

Maybe you have BELIEFS between you and happiness. Learn How to start working with the BELIEF SYSTEMS of happiness.


How to escape the hidden trap everyone exposed to self help psychology falls inside. If you fixed your life and solved all of your problems suddenly you would become happy. There is a superior more advance methods used by all successful people.

Understand the barriers between you and the happiness process.

Repeat, happiness is a life process. The number of hours in a day are fixed but you can spend more of them happy. RSVP for the "HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO" right now,before you start making excuses again. What if you miss the answer to your happiness because of excuses or your beliefs?
RSVP for the "HAPPY BRAIN STUDIO" right now. :)


Location: Ripley-Grier 
520 8th Avenue 17 FL 
Between 36th and 37th street 
New York, NY 10018 
Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.
Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 17 Floor
Walk though the glass doors and turn left and at the end 
turn right then left to the end of the hall
NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.
Room: 17 M

Online $10.00

Door $15.00


MATERIALS fee included! We use materials because we are always doing active processes based on brain and cognitive dynamics. WE USE STUFF TO MAKE SURE YOU GET RESULTS.
Each group session Rule: "What You Learn Today You Can Use Today"New members at some point start scrabbling to find pen and paper because they show up with an expectation the session is a sale pitch for something else. When "First timers"discover there is a NEW system of knowledge based on new tools, processes and understanding they start asking "do you have a pen and paper I can borrow?" Each session you always learn something you can use walking out the door.

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

results.description:
Join Doc Dailey as he covers the basics of making successful molds, including block molds and two-part molds. 

We will cover prep for your original piece, how to decide on the best type of mold to use, assembling the mold and prepping the mold for successful castings.  

We will cover the anatomy of a mold and what makes one successful (or not) and how to avoid issues while molding (mold locking, air bubbles, etc)  At the end of this class, you will be able to make basic molds and be ready to pour your first castings. 


In order to signup for this event, please goto the following URL to pay for your ticket.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/how-to-make-molds-tickets-20706208828

We will have sample kits for purchase to allow you to practice your mold making skills. These kits are from a company called, ComposiMold and are reuasable, which is great for learning. 


ComposiMold - Original 6oz  (great for all types of molds) MSRP $15.99  Your price $14.50

ComposiMold - Food Contact 6oz (great for food molding) MSRP $15.99 Your price $14.50
results.name: How to make Molds

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
La Superior.. It's one of those spots in one of my favorite parts of NYC. Also, it's in a dark garage in Williamsburg with delicious food!

What more can you ask for?!? Keeping it grungy on the outside yet upright on the inside La Superior is one of those instant classics that keep you coming back for more. Tacos, are very affordable @ $2.50 each. There are many other delicious side pieces you can get if you just want more to eat. To top that off I say we order a pitcher of their classic margarita and keep the night flowin.


We need some of our Tuesday peeps to occupy this spot like the 1% so let's get busy on yet another Tuesday night!

Keep in mind La Superior is a cash only joint. Pay that extra at the bodega ATM or bring your money up front cause Williamsburg is not big bank friendly. Let's cap off January and Enter February roaring at La Superior. It's gonna be yet another dope Tuesday night out!

WoRD!

results.description:
***Our dinner will have ONE SEATING ONLY, at 7:00pm sharp. Please plan to arrive on time. After dinner, there will be an optional free comedy show at 8:15pm.***

The V-Spot Cafe is a popular and beloved 100% Latin Vegan restaurant with two locations: in Park Slope, Brooklyn and in the East Vilage. It is owned and operated by brothers (and meetup group members) Danny Carabano and Alex Carabano.

I've got some wonderful news. They are opening a third location on East 24th Street right next to the New York Comedy Club. This new location has not been advertised to the general public and is having a "soft opening" that few people know about. This location has a limited menu, and as is the case with all V Spot locations, it is 100% vegan!

I am a one of their huge fans, as are many of our group members, so let's be among the very first to check them out at the new V Spot location! And after dinner, at 8:15pm, you have the option of staying for a free comedy show featuring Alex Carabano!! Details are further below.

You may know that V Spot Owner Alex Carabano is a rising young comic. He is tremendously funny. After our dinner, Alex along with two other comedians will be performing a free comedy show. The show will begin at 8:15pm. The show is optional for our dinner attendees, and it's ok if you have to leave after dinner. Alex has already had great success as a professional comic, here is his bio:

Alex is quickly on the rise with his humor about his veggie diet in a closed-minded Colombian family, his liquid diet of Jameson & ginger ale, playing soccer with Jamaicans as a teenager, and working the restaurant business for many years now. Alex's talents have landed him on BET's "Apollo Live" where he won $1000 surviving the legendary Apollo theater, the CBS season premiere of "The Job," Sirius XM radio's "American Latino Radio," PETA Latino, & across the Caribbean on TV via "Island Xclusive." (Follow Alex on Instagram - @alexcarabano)

Here's a video of Alex showing off the new space while it was still under construction... I notice he uses a particular modifier to describe "meetups". LOL. I think I will adopt the same language when describing the group.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TIc_3HM-Bw4

If you're not done watching videos, here's another with some behind-the-scenes info about New York Comedy Club and the new V Spot, and their fabulous pedigree. (Really, it is fabulous. ) Pedigree!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bU8M_RH0FNs

Even the world's longest meetup description must come to an end. Let's get to it.

Train Directions: 6 Train to 23rd Street (and Park Ave.) or N or R Trains to 23rd Street (and Broadway) or F Train to 23rd Street (and 6th Ave.)

How to find our group:  We'll pretty much be taking over V Spot. It is right next to New York Comedy Club. They are affiliated with each other. You will see our large group in the restaurant.


I am so excited that the amazing V-Spot is opening a third location in the Flat Iron/Gramercy area. Let's be among the very first to check it out! And then stay for some great free comedy, featuring Alex Carabano.


David

results.description:
Figure Drawing with Color

Schedule: Six sessions, Tuesday evenings, 7 - 9:30pm, January 5, 12, 19, 26, February 2, 9, 2016
At Shoestring Press, 663 Classon Ave, Brooklyn 11238

About the course:
In this course we’ll work from life with models each session, and you will develop your grasp of the basic tenants of Figure Drawing—gesture, line quality, sighting and measuring, value, anatomy and portraiture—while introducing color. We'll explore watercolor, ink washes and chalk pastel. Over the course of six sessions, we'll have the chance to develop the composition through sustained poses. Previous experience drawing the figure from life is encouraged but not required.

$240, Returning students receive 20% off. Sign up on Square Marketplace.

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Bitly

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

Professionals in healthcare across all functions and roles in the industry come together to network. This is the place to get new business contacts, find a new job, identify new customers and vendors, announce your start up, volunteer for a not-for-profit patient organization, meet industry connections, and make new friends. 

At this event, in addition to our usual networking, we are going to put focus on making a difference, doing for others and putting our strength in numbers to work. Do good, feel good. 

We will have representatives from various not-for-profits presenting and sharing information on their organizations and offering opportunities to get involved. 

Healthcare professionals can make a difference!! 

Invite your co-workers to attend. This is event is FREE to attend but you must sign up.   

If you are involved with a not-for-profit organization and want to do a 5 minute pitch at this event please fill out the application on www.healthcarepn.com. 


This event is hosted by the not-for-profit AHF PHARMACY (www.ahfpharmacy.org) and sponsored by LUPUS FRIENDS AND FAMILY FOUNDATION  (www.LupusFriendsAndFamily.org)

results.description:
Alrighty, we're in the home stretch!

You may notice that we've used the same graphic for the last 3 events - that's because two weeks ago, Mike Benjamin brought up a fascinating discussion around the disconnect between diagnostic medicine and the patient's access to pertinent and accurate information. Over the last few weeks, we've put together a rough plan on how to tackle this problem, and this Tuesday we'll put the finishing touches on it.

This will be the final week that we explore this topic, so keep an eye out for a new series of events to be announced shortly, followed by the new format coming out the first week of March - for more on that, swing by the meetup and I'll explain it all in person (otherwise look for a more official announcement in two weeks).

See you guys soon!

Dan

We meet every 2d, 4th and 5th Tuesday of the month from 7pm - 8:30pm at the Main Clifton public library. Guests 18 and over are welcome to watch the meeting for free.


Joining the club- A membership application and fee must be submitted to become a member of the club. There are 2 visits required.

results.description:
LI Graphic Novel Readers and The Bellmore Memorial Library will be consolidating our 3 graphic novel book clubs (House Blend/Homepages/Community Matters) into one for 2016! This new superclub will stick with the House Blend name, but will meet twice each month and cover 2 related graphic novels per meeting! 

As for location, we'll be rotating between The Bellmore Bean coffeeshop, Panera Bread, and the Library (all located in Bellmore, NY), but no matter where we are, there will be coffee, and nibbles to enjoy during the discussion (and -- bonus! -- they'll be free when we meet at the Library). 

We'll also have graphic novel raffles for folks who RSVP through Meet-Up or the Library's website. So let us know that you're coming and you may walk away with more than just coffee and the joy that comes with great conversation!

Join us at our next meeting on January 26th (see info below) to help shape the club's schedule and choose the books we'll be reading in the future. We want to hear from you!

Books for Tuesday, January 26th, 2016: 

Just So Happens / by Fumio Obata 

Level Up / Gene Luen Yang & Thien Pham

Just So Happens follows the journey of Yumiko, who was born in Japan but has made a life for herself in London. She has a gallery show of her art, a satisfying job, and a good guy she plans to marry. The culture she grew up in seems very far away—until she gets a phone call that changes her life. Returning to Japan, Yumiko feels caught between eastern and western cultures, between being an adult and a child, and between her past and her future. In Level Up we meet first-generation American, Dennis, who is trying to fulfill his immigrant parents' dreams by walking away from his own. As he tries to balance staying true to himself with the responsibility he feels towards his family, he faces his greatest crisis of conscience -- who exactly is he? We'll look at how these characters navigate the changing nature of their lives, and explore how all of us figure out who we are, where we belong, and what values we hold dear.

Pick up a copy of both books at the Bellmore Library, just ask for them at the Circulation Desk and mention that you're with the House Blend Graphic Novel Club. This club is open to all, Bellmore residency is not required, so join us!

Questions or comments? Call librarian Valerie Acklin at (516)[masked] or email at [masked].

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

results.description:
We will begin our evening with a few ritual demonstrations for creating sacred space, cleansing, clearing and healing. 

We will use minerals, crystals, elixirs, sound and angel cards to cleanse, align and bring in the highest healing vibrations into our scared space.

A ritual returns you to what matters. The very act of beginning a ritual puts us in a state of mind where we can break with the routine patterns of the mundane and remember the sacred.

What makes a ritual sacred?

A ritual is any action we take that has meaning beyond its appearance. What makes a ritual sacred, however, is the intention behind it. The word “sacred” comes from the Latin word sacrum, which relates to power or strength. So, a sacred ritual is an exchange or action that you imbue with meaning, thus giving it power. Rituals can have a impact on people’s thoughts, feelings, and behaviors.

All are welcome and will have an opportunity to receive Reiki healing.

results.description:
The first two Donnie Yen Ip Man films can be streamed on Netflix.  They're great but not pre-requisites.  

Donnie Yen ignites the screen in a return to his iconic role of Ip Man, the real-life Wing Chun Kung Fu master who mentored Bruce Lee. In this explosive third installment of the blockbuster martial arts series, when a band of brutal gangsters led by a crooked property developer (Mike Tyson) make a play to take over the city, Master Ip is forced to take a stand.  Fists will fly as some of the most incredible fight scenes ever filmed, choreographed by the legendary Yuen Woo Ping (THE MATRIX, KILL BILL), play out on the big screen in this soon-to-be classic of the genre.

Grady Hendrix, founder of the NY Asian Film Festival wrote this for Film Comment.  

Instructions. 

Look for me in the lobby at 7:15 in a Gap baseball cap.  Showtime is 7:35. 

RSPV by Sunday to be eligible for one of four free tickets courtesy of Amplify Releasing, longtime supporters of my meetups.  Winners will be notified on Monday & must meet me by in the lobby by 7:15, no later. 

https://youtu.be/jckXscMwIOI

results.description:
http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/6/b/b/event_7042203.jpegCome join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) in a lively, friendly, facilitated discussion group for men, women, genderqueer, transgender, and not-quite-sure people, as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension, as long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual, bi-curious, questioning, queer, “I don’t label myself,” bi-friendly or some other non-monosexual identity).

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave.

The group meets at The LOFT, the LGBTQ safe space in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month.

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.
results.name: 4th Tuesday Westchester Bisexual Discussion & Support Group

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Set at a seaside resort, Gustav (Craig Smith) befriends an impressionable highly successful young artist, Adolph (Josh Tyson). Under Gustav’s relentless questioning Adolph’s fears of infidelity of his novelist wife Tekla (Elise Stone) come ragingly to the forefront. It ultimately becomes clear that the manipulative Gustav is scheming a psychological deadly plot in this fatal sexual--part carnival funhouse--triangle. Described as "chilling but surprisingly comedic” Los Angels Times

Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.” Discount tickets for New York Theatre Under $25 Meetup @ $15 each. Use the code “Meet3” when ordering your tickets either by phone at[masked] or online at https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10016230

results.description:
EVERYONE IN THIS GROUP CAN GET FREE TICKETS to a great comedy show at one of the BEST comedy clubs in NYC!! 

Tickets are normally priced at $15 each!  You can get your FREE ticket by RSVPing w/ group and using the online link below -

FREE TICKET LINK: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-tues-jan-26th-930pm-tickets-20791316387


The show is called "Comedy Juice" and features all professional comedians (no amateurs), who you've seen on: Comedy Central, Saturday Night Live, Chelsea Lately, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Conan, etc), HBO, Showtime, & More! This show definitely features some of the BEST comedians in comedy!


In the past 2 months, this show has had HUGE special guests including: Kevin Hart, Dave Attell, Jim Gaffigan, Judah Friedlander, & Louis CK!!

There's a great bar next door called Jake's Saloon that everyone can meet up at before the show, this is the easiest way to find & meet the group! Meet there by 9pm and go in all together!!  We'll have a few Meetup groups joining us. Ask for Meetup (Chris Millhouse) when you arrive at Jake's.

The show is 18+ & Gotham Comedy Club has a 2 drink minimum per person (drinks don't have to be alcohol)

Hope to see you all at the show!

FREE TICKET LINK: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-tues-jan-26th-930pm-tickets-20791316387

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes; timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Your in business to do what you do best, now you need  bookkeeping, tax preparation and payroll services.   Taking care of your entity set up, sales tax reports, payroll reports, and taxes are such an important part of the business which is so difficult to understand.   An expert is recommended for these services  so you can be ready for whatever this crazy economy throws your way.  Studies have shown that when businesses specialize they become more successful as well as profitable.  With new tax laws in effect it's more important than ever to get the deductions and credits you deserve.  We are pleased to announce Brian Walsh, Enrolled Agent, will be speaking today about the complex tax laws of 2016.  Lowering your tax burden is the goal, so Mr. Walsh takes a strategic approach that looks at the entire financial situation for a business or individual.   Brians firm is large enough to offer a full range of professional services, but small enough to give you the individual attention you deserve.  When you have a tax question and need accurate advice and tax planning during the year, Brian Walsh will be here for you no matter how simple or complex your return.  Business owners are double taxed and they don't even know it!!!  Stop overpaying on your taxes.  Brian sees many business owners that are paying way too much self employment tax in addition to federal, state, and other local taxes. 


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

results.description:
Click here to register!

In this one-hour presentation, Bruce Fraser and Roman Bogomazov, both nationally recognized experts who teach the Wyckoff Method of trading and investing at the Golden Gate University, will describe in detail several practical trading tools originally developed by Richard D. Wyckoff a century ago. Many successful professional and institutional traders today rely on Wyckoff's timeless principles, which were derived from his observations of the market activities of large operators and legendary traders, including Jesse Livermore and James Keene.

In an engaging interactive dialogue, Bruce and Roman will illustrate how traders can learn to anticipate the future direction of a stock or other security through analysis of: •The structural position of the overall market and specific equities in relation to trends or trading ranges
•Stock and industry comparative and relative strength
•Supply and demand confirmation of directional bias

These veteran instructors and traders will also discuss tactics that one can use in different phases of trading ranges and trends. Traders of all levels of skill and experience will enjoy and benefit from this presentation.

Both Bruce and Roman have many years of experience trading and teaching the Wyckoff Method. Bruce is also a weekly Wyckoff blogger for Stockcharts.com and Roman is a Principal and Instructor at wyckoffanalytics.com.
results.name: Analyzing and Trading Markets with the Wyckoff Method

Being a freelance photographer requires many things; talent, grit, hard word, patience, a sense of humor and most of all a COMMUNITY. In the last 20 years, Dorie Hagler has grown a community rather than her ego. Looking back, her best opportunities, whether they be assignments, gallery shows or public art commissions, all happened because of her photographer friends and colleagues within the industry.

So let’s explore the many ways to grow your photography community and land more assignments. Dorie will share with you the twisty, turny road her career has taken and how she can draw a line from her successes straight to her photographer friends.

Let’s share ideas. Come join this community.

ABOUT DORIE:
Dorie Hagler is a storyteller and an advocate. She advocates for people, communities, and businesses by telling their stories in a compelling, honest and humanizing way. Dorie is inspired by the stories regardless of whether they are news breaking international natural disasters or her hometown's rodeo queen competition.

Dorie's photographs appear in distinguished publications such as The New York Times, Sports Illustrated, The Chicago Tribune, The Denver Post, The Albuquerque Journal, The Taos News, Ski Magazine, New Mexico Magazine, Mothering Magazine and many others.

Dorie is a project photographer for international non-profits, local non-profits and documentary film-makers and has been awarded public art commissions by The State of New Mexico.

Images from her personal documentary projects are collected by museums, public buildings and state agencies throughout New Mexico and the United States.

Dorie lives in New York with her husband and her two daughters.

In June 2015 I assumed the role as US Director for the Israel Venture Network, an innovative venture philanthropy/impact investing organization focused on strengthening social businesses in Israel that provide employment & career advancement opportunities to the country's most vulnerable populations. We manage four social business investment funds and are currently incubating 30+ portfolio companies. I wanted to be sure to personally invite and encourage members of this group to attend our upcoming IVN Yozma Fund Launch event on January 27 from 5:30-7:30pm at a very cool social business here in NYC (Colors Restaurant.) We will be celebrating the launch of our ground-breaking social investment fund - created in partnership with the Israeli government, philanthropy & business - and will be featuring expert speakers to talk more about social impact investing and the growing social business ecosystem. The Fund’s Social Mission is to create an opportunity for sustainable social change by investing in and mentoring social businesses that focus on vocational training and employment for: Youth-at- risk, People with special needs, Recovering addicts, Released convicts, Chronically unemployed, Elderly, and Single parents.

The invitation can be viewed here:
http://us12.campaign-archive2.com/?u=469cc2d80f2cd1713a799cb15&id=a7f9a36678

Included on the invite is the link to RSVP:

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at[masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups andwww.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: NY's Friendliest Social Networking & After Work Happy Hour--Free Event

Hi all, 

We'll continue with practice case interviews. We take turns working through and giving cases, usually getting through 1 or 2 per person. Please come prepared to work through some cases (i.e., bring paper, pens, and some practice cases). All experience levels are welcome.

Location: Tasty Cafe, 128 Madison Ave New York, NY 10016 b/t 30th St & 31st St in Midtown East

Nearest Train Stations: 
33rdSt. (6) 
34th St. Herald Sq. (B, D, F, M, N, Q, R) 
33rd St. (PATH) 

Hope to see you there!

ABOUT US:  We focus on practicing management consulting case interview preparation.   Whether you are a seasoned professional or just looking to land your first dream job at a high-flying consulting firm, you've come to the right place! Aside from solving business cases, the group is also great place to meet and network with others interested in management consulting.

All experience levels are welcome, from absolute beginners to seasoned consultants looking for extra practice.

Our group is open to students and professionals across the globe.  

Case Interview Practice Partner - Case Interview Practice Questions - Case Interview Practice Cases - Case Interview Practice Preparation

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Join us for our weekly hacknight for Django developers + newcomers to work on their projects and/or connect with other developers. For best results, bring your laptop.

Our host, Reelio, will be providing drinks and snacks.

Say hello on IRC! We're #django-nyc on Freenode.

About our host Reelio

Reelio makes it easy to work with the YouTube creators your audience already loves, placing your brand at the center of hundreds of engaging and authentic videos. 

The need for brands to be on YouTube is essential. It is the second largest search engine (behind Google), is 20X more engaging than Facebook and 40% more shareable than text. Yet, more than 50% of videos published by the top 100 brands receive fewer than 1000 views. 

Reelio analyzes millions of YouTube videos and channels, transforming reams of data into actionable information for brands to better engage their desired audiences in online video. Thought of as the “match.com for brands and online video creators”, Reelio enables partnerships that are data-driven, people-approved. Completed pilots with Reelio have resulted in, an average of, over 150X the views and 700X the social engagements of brands’ previous in-house video attempts.
results.name: Weekly Django Hacknight @ Reelio

venue.name: The New York Life Insurance Co,

results.description:
The Topic

Risk Management is a very important aspect of trading. Learn when to take profits and when to cut your losses. Successful traders know when a certain stock hits a resistant or support level. .For example, if a stock is approaching a key resistance level after a large move upward, traders may want to sell before a period of consolidation takes place. Learn where these areas are. John Gagliardi is very talented on explaining Risk Management and other type of stock analysis. The Fidelity Trading Advantage will also be included in the discussion .Questions and Answers will follow.

A $10.00 charge willl be collected at the door to cover expenses  Please arrive early for registration.

John Gagliardi's  Bio

Title: Vice President Brokerage, NY Tri-State Area, Fidelity Active Trader Services

Profile: John is the Regional Vice President of Brokerage across the New York Tri-State region. His primary responsibility is to educate investors about the tools and services that are provided by Fidelity Investments.  Additionally, he conducts seminars on financial education both locally and on a national level.

 During the internet revolution, John was at the forefront, working with the pioneers of Direct Access trading where he trained professional traders.  John is highly proficient in Technical Analysis, Fundamental Research, Options, ETF’s, Market Mechanics as well as the Fixed Income marketplace.  He has lectured thousands of individual investors nation wide as a keynote speaker for the Money Show and Online Traders Expo.  John has been with Fidelity Investments since 2004. 

Education: John graduated from New York University with a Bachelor of Arts in Business and Legal Studies.
results.name: NYC STOCK TRADERS MEETUP - RISK MANAGEMENT

group.name: The New York City Stock Traders  Meetup Group

I will also be emailing everyone 2 days prior to confirm. If I receive no confirmation within about 24 hours, I reserve the right to change your RSVP so someone on the waitlist can join.

results.description:
Lambda architectures for Big Data sprung out of the concept that stream processing is fast but inaccurate. So you needed to have a fast but less accurate streaming path along with a slower, accurate batch path. With the advent of technologies like Ratsoda and Samza, this is no longer the case. 

Come find out how AppNexus does real-time streaming joins across our entire platform to the tune of 200+ billion rows per day with minimal latency on minimal hardware.

Register to attend via bit.ly/appnexustechtalks.

Food, drink & interactive tech demos on arrival!

If you've been wondering how to add some humor to your presentations, whether formal or informal, come to a meeting of Humorous Toastmasters.  This is a "specialty" club - open to anyone interested in joining, but which specializes in encouraging experimentation with humor in every aspect of the meeting, from introductions to prepared speeches.  As our club president used to say, we're not funny people, we're people trying to become funnier.

For more information about Toastmasters program, go to www.Toastmasters.org

Join us for the Open Entrepreneur Pitching Event for Digital Media, High Tech and Healthcare Start-Ups

Every Entrepreneur Gets a Table - We Bring the Investors to You!

Now with more Investors than ever! Every Start-Up gets to pitch to our team of Investors - the audience gets to find out what's new in the Start-Up market, and what VC's are really looking for!

Plus we have added our famous Capital Raising Workshop - use our mastermind group to shape your winning pitch. All our last winners or finalist have graduated from this workshop.

Capital Raising Workshop  3:30 - 5: 30 pm

Startup Pitching 6:00 - 9:00 pm

After more than 10 years of helping selected Entrepreneurs raise capital - we've figured how to open it up to everyone!

This innovative event gives every Entrepreneur a shot at getting the attention of Angel Investors on the lookout for new deals. Tech & Digital Media VCs and execs get a unique opportunity to survey the marketplace at their own pace.

Startupalooza is a unique pitching contest where all start ups are ranked by a large group on Investors. The Top 4 get to do a public "pitch-off" and the winner gets up to $4500 in prizes.

I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at pret a manger to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person.


My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

group.name: Victory Pints: Board Games and Beer

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: New & Existing Member Social Networking & After Work  Party--Free Event

Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.

Spotlight on Innovation + Inspiration + Process is a free event for creative, marketing, design, and tech professionals to hear from 4 of the leading companies in the digital industry about their latest projects and what drives their innovation. This is a unique opportunity for creative & tech professionals to not only learn about ways to improve their processes, but network with likeminded professionals and hiring decision makers.


The event will begin with an hour for open networking and feature several key speakers: Aaron Harnly, Chief Technology Officer at Amplify; Michael Clark, Principal at Beeby, Clark + Meyler; Stephanie Fleischman, Director of Ad Innovation at The New York Times; and Jeremy Strauser, Vice President and General Manager of Digital at Topps. After the speaker presentations, there will be a Q&A session with our panel.


This is an open event, so feel free to pass along to your friends in the industry as well! Over 180 people have registered through our event page - making this a great opportunity to connect with professionals with a diverse range of backgrounds.


You can register for this free event, here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/spotlight-on-innovation-inspiration-process-registration-19849089160?aff=meetup

Roy Haynes is arguably the greatest living jazz musician, and inarguably one of my two favorite drummers of all time! I've seen Roy play probably over 300 times, the latest being last November, and at 90 years old, he's still playing great. You can learn more about Roy and the event here: http://www.bluenote.net/newyork/schedule/moreinfo.cgi?id=13744.

The Blue Note tends to fill up quickly after they open the doors at 6:00, so this is when we'll meet there for dinner. I'll make sure I snag us optimum seating. The first set begins at 8:00. The cost is $45, with a $5 food or drink minimum, plus tax and tip, plus a $2 organizer fee. I'll try to arrange for separate checks, but just in case, please make things easy for everyone by bringing cash, including small bills.

The informal deadline to cancel will be 1/21, the following day after which I'll make reservations for the group. Please, only serious RSVPs. It's important for me to keep a good reputation at these clubs, so frivolous late cancellations will lead to expulsion from the group.

Interested in innovation? Tech?

http://www.ventureoutny.com/event/scandinaviajanuary2016#pitch

results.description:
In the world of entrepreneurship one of the most important things is being able to adapt to the times. 2016 is a new year with important major trends and changes we can expect with new trends in marketing, funding, and new industries. In true to the concept of adapting to 2016, we will be filming the event in 360 virtual reality and give a brief lesson on how to film content in VR with 360Fly. The event will be divided into three major parts.

1. Funding and Regulation for Startups- the focus will be about SEC Title 3 Crowdfunding regulations, which are going to allow for the creation of equity crowdfunding platforms. Speaker is Liberty McAteer

2. Social Media and Marketing- this will identify the growth and popularity of live streaming platforms like Periscope and Meerkat for marketing. Speaker is Vin Nolan who is a Periscope influencer and was a headliner at the 2016 Periscope Summit.

3. New Industries- This will be a discussion about how the release of Oculus, HTC Vive, and Playstation VR will create a new VR industry in the same capacity like the iPhone release in 2007 created a new eco-system for startups in mobile. While also understanding how it can be a disruptive force in already established industries. We will also dedicate a portion of time at the event for networking.

Please make sure to purchase ticket on Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/e/2016-highlights-for-entrepreneurs-tickets-20906766702
results.name: 2016 Highlights for Entrepreneurs

results.description:
Only $175 for the entire 13 week semester! Please email or message el centro to confirm we are still accepting students before coming to this class. 

In the Level 3 Spanish class students will already have a working knowledge, but more advanced capacity, in the basics of conversation. At this level students will be expected to have gained the ability to read and write simple sentences. The main objectives of Level 3 will be to improve fluidity, improve vocabulary and improve overall understanding of spoken and written Spanish. After one term in level 3 students will be prepared for basic and brief conversations. After two terms in level 3 students will have finished with the a more advanced conversational ability in anticipation of the level 4 environment. 

En la clase de Nivel 3 de español, alumnos ya tendrán un conocimiento práctico pero mas avanzado en cuanto los conceptos básicos de conversación.  En éste nivel se esperará que los estudiantes han obtenido la capacidad de leer y escribir oraciones simples.  Los principales objetivos del nivel 3 serán mejorar la fluidez de los estudiantes, mejorar el vocabulario y mejorar la comprensión general del español hablado y escrito.  Después de un semestre en el nivel 3 los estudiantes estarán preparados para conversaciones básicas y breves.  Después de dos semestres en el nivel 3 los alumnos terminaran con la capacidad para conversaciones y comunicaciones escritas mas avanzadas en anticipación al ambiente del nivel 4.
results.name: Spanish 3 - Intermediate Conversational Spanish

https://youtu.be/Sgl3PqnNbyI


Are you a Foreign National who is passionate about launching or furthering your career in the United States?

Are you a foreign student, graduate, or tourist looking to remain in the US and work? Are you a current H1B VISA holder looking to switch jobs?

Click here to Buy Tickets

NY Career Meetup will  get answers for these tough topics and much more!

Click here to Buy Tickets

Join us for an exclusive, information-packed Roundtable event, with an experienced immigration lawyer, recruiters, a career coach, lots of experience, and one agenda: How to get job sponsorship in the US.

Who Should Attend?

Those ambitious job seekers looking for savvy, inside info on the A to Z's of understanding H1Bs and getting job sponsorship in the US, including:

-What is the H1B work visa program?

-What is the process to acquire to acquire an H1B (costs, timelines, F1 to H1B, employer requirements)

-Types of companies that generally hire H1Bs

-How to market yourself smart in your H1B-focused job search

-How consulting companies and H1Bs work

-Employer bonds for H1Bs

-H1B renewals

-Next steps after H1B – Green Card, etc.

And more!

Click here to Buy Tickets

NOTE: This event provides targeted networking and learning opportunities with very seasoned and successful recruiting, immigration and career development professionals. Meet them in person, form partnerships, and learn how to be strategic and smart in pursuing job sponsorship in the US.

*Light refreshments will be served*

Early Bird: $15

Discounted Online registration: $20 

Regular Online: $25

At the door: $30

Click here to Buy Tickets

*Note: we expect this event to sell out prior to Jan 27th, so please purchase your ticket now to ensure your seat.

  Featured Panelists:

Deborah J. Notkin

Ms. Notkin is a partner in the firm of Barst Mukamal & Kleiner LLP and maintains a large business immigration and nationality practice. She is a past president of the American Immigration Lawyers Association (AILA),[masked] and serves on its Board of Governors.

A noted expert in immigration she is a frequent lecturer at the Practicing Law Institute, the New York State Bar Association and AILA. Human Resource Magazine has named Ms. Notkin one of the 15 most powerful business immigration attorneys in the U.S.

Ms. Notkin is listed in Best Lawyers in America; the International Who is Who of Corporate Immigration Lawyers, and Chambers USA as recommended immigration counsel. New York Super Lawyers has listed her as one of the top immigration attorneys in New York. Her numerous articles on business immigration have been cited frequently in other articles on immigration.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/deborah-notkin-62070632

Jordan Haberfield

With a 25+ year career aligning Talent Management and Recruiting strategies with tangible business value across multiple industries/fields (finance, technology, pharmaceuticals, marketing, etc), Jordan has been successful in helping companies implement successful initiatives in Recruitment Strategy Development, Full Life-Cycle Recruiting Process Design and Improvements, Retained and Contingent Search and Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Integrations.

After co-founding and building one of the first and most influential technology staffing, executive search and consulting firms focused in the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) space, Jordan spent 10 years working with other fast-growing technology and management consulting firms advising CXO clients on recruiting, lead generation and talent management strategies.

Leveraging his experience working with executives and senior technologists, Jordan now help clients find and attract the key resources they need to succeed and grow.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/jordanhaberfield

                                             Moderator:

Vicki Aubin

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') helps career revolutionaries to unleash their inner rockstar and reinvent themselves. A career transition and personal branding specialist, Vicki helps her clients to crank up the volume on their most marketable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. 

With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, over a decade in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche and Morgan Stanley), and as a successful career transitioner herself, Vicki has been a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series and a mock interviewer for several educational institutions including the NYU Stern School of Business, Rutgers University and The Flatiron School.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com or on Twitter at @rockincareer.

Click here to Buy Tickets

Event Sponsored by NY CAREER MEETUP


Connect with us

http://www.meetup.com/NY-Career-Meetup

https://www.facebook.com/NyCareerGroup/

results.description:
The Master Class is a program for early stage small business owners and nonprofit leaders who are interested in taking their initiative to the next level. Starting in January 2016, participants attend seven classes that will cover various aspects of the business development process (marketing, accessing finance, developing a business plan, pitching and more). Classes are taught buy local leaders and experts. The program concludes with a pitch presentation at our Annual Reception and Mentee Showcase on April 6, 2016.

Master Class sessions will be held every few weeks in downtown Manhattan in the evening. Each participant will also be assigned a mentor to work with them one-to-one between classes. Candidates should be able to demonstrate some early proficiency or track record of success with their initiative. Participants are expected to attend all sessions.

Apply today!

Open to initiatives from diverse industries, including products and services.

Applications will be reviewed and you will be informed of your status in mid-January. The application deadline is January 8 . There is no cost to participate.

Program dates: January 27, February 4, February 17, March 2, March 16, March 23, March 30 and April 6 (pitch presentations).

Questions? Call BAF at[masked] or email [masked].
results.name: 2016 Master Class - Apply Today!

venue.name: Bank of America Winter Village at Bryant Park

results.description:
Get out of the cold and onto the ice!

Welcome to my seventh annual mid-week ice skating night at Bryant Park!  Enjoy skating under the skyscrapers of Midtown Manhattan with your fellow JOCers followed by an option for a bite to eat at a local kosher eatery.

ORGANIZER: Nachi Winkler

COST: Skating is free!

THE CATCH: There is a charge for skate rentals, for lock purchase for the lockers, and an option to check your bag.  So in reality your cost will depend on whether you have your own skates, your own lock, and whether you bring a bag or not. 


updated pricing rates:

http://wintervillage.org/skate/pricing

THE GOOD NEWS: If you bring your own skates, your own lock, and arrive with minimal baggage and regular sized shoes you can actually skate for free!

THE PLAN

The game plan is to arrive at around 6:30 PM (you can arrive later if you need to) to meet up in the lobby, check in with me, and rent skates; hit the ice around 6:45 and skate until around 8:30; return skates and meet again by 8:45 in the lobby; and walk together to a kosher eatery a few blocks away to get a bite to eat and hang out together until they kick us out (around 10 PM).

IMPORTANT FRIENDLY TIPS

-Do leave the extra baggage at home.  That means avoid bringing backpacks, briefcases, lunch boxes, etc. so that you will be able to fit your shoes and any minimal accessories you have into one locker.

-If you have your own lock, bring it and save yourself the lock purchase fee.

-There is a safety rule against skating with any type of bag on, including backpacks, which is strictly enforced by the staff on the rink.

-Do bring anybody who you wouldn’t be embarrassed to be seen with in public. Just make sure each person registers individually via the Meetup page.

For more information about the venue visit:

http://bryantpark.org/things-to-do/wintervillage.html

http://wintervillage.org

I hope you can join us!

Nachi Winkler
results.how_to_find_us: Meet me in the lobby to sign in. (I will try to wear something with the JOC logo on it.)
results.name: Seventh Annual Mid-Week Ice Skating Night at Bryant Park

Join us at one of the coolest lounges in NYC for an evening of networking and drinks with many of the best Entrepreneurs NYC has to offer!

Atmosphere: 
- The dress code is Business Casual. 
- We will provide name tags for everyone that attends. We ask that you put your name and industry on your name tag. 
- Make sure you bring enough business cards.

Time is Precious: 
- Event is from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time so everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like.

Admission: 
- FREE for the First 1000 RSVP on Meetup 
- $20 for everyone else

Drinks: 
- 2 drink norm, 1 drink min. Because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event, all our networking events require a "2 drink norm, 1 drink minimum!"

***Since this is a drinking establishment, all attendees must be 21+.***

***************************
EVENT SPONSOR:
Breather - Contact: Lee Moulton 
http://www.breather.com 
- Breather provides on-demand hourly space rentals. Use code: NYESNJAN to receive 25% off through 2/14!
-----------

For those who want extra exposure at our events you can do so by becoming a sponsor.  As a courtesy we only accept one sponsor in each industry. Benefits of becoming a sponsor are: your company name, link to your website, and a short company description will be include in the event page and our emails.

 CLICK HERE TO RESERVE YOUR SPONSOR SPOT NOW!

Venue Sponsor: 
We are constantly looking for new and exciting venues to use.  If you have a venue and you would like us to consider using it please contact Trang at Trang [masked].

Please don't spam our members in the comment section with your company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be ban from the group.
